column2: Job Title: General Manager  Finance.Location: Bhubaneswar, India.About the Role: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced General Manager of Finance to oversee our company's financial operations. The ideal candidate will be a certified Chartered Accountant (CA) with a solid background in finance, taxation, and logistics, particularly within the Infrastructure sector. This role requires a strategic thinker who can lead our finance team, ensuring compliance, optimizing operations, and contributing significantly to our overall business strategy.Key Responsibilities:Financial Management and Strategy: 1. Oversee the financial operations of the company, including financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis. 2. Develop and implement financial strategies that align with the company's overall objectives. 3. Lead financial reporting, ensuring accuracy and compliance with statutory requirements and international financial standards. Taxation and Compliance: 1. Manage and oversee the complete taxation process, including GST returns filing, handling notices, audits, hearings, and other statutory compliance matters. 2. Analyze trends in raw material prices and indices, advising management on procurement strategies to mitigate the impact of price fluctuations. 3. Ensure timely compliance with all tax obligations, optimizing tax planning and review, and effectively managing tax provisions and compliance processes. Customs and Logistics Management: 1. Leverage extensive experience in customs for exports and imports, ensuring compliance and efficient handling of customs-related issues. 2. Strategize and manage logistics operations, optimizing freight costs, and ensuring effective shipment routes. 3. Identify opportunities for cost optimization and efficiency improvements in logistics and supply chain processes.Team Leadership and Development: 1. Lead and develop a high-performing finance team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and professional growth. 2. Ensure clear communication and effective collaboration within the team and with other departments. Project Management: 1. Manage and participate in finance-related projects, such as E-Way Bill Automation, IRN Automation, and Outbound Delivery Automation, ensuring successful implementation and alignment with business goals. 2. Contribute to cross-functional projects, providing financial expertise and insights. Stakeholder Engagement: 1. Engage with internal and external stakeholders, including departmental heads, auditors, and regulatory authorities, ensuring strong relationships and effective communication. 2. Provide strategic financial advice to senior management and other key stakeholders.   Qualifications:1. Certified Chartered Accountant (CA) with a strong academic record. 2. Minimum of 12 years of experience in finance, taxation, and logistics, preferably in the Infrastructure sector. 3. Proven track record in leading finance teams, managing taxation, customs, and logistics functions. 4. Strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial software and systems such as SAP HANA, SAP FICO, Oracle, and Tally ERP. 5. Excellent communication, critical thinking, and interpersonal skills. 6. Fluent in English (Mandatory), Hindi and Oriya. Strong leadership and team management skills, with a commitment to driving financial excellence. What We Offer: A challenging and rewarding role in one of the fastest growing Infrastructure Company, with opportunities for personal growth and career advancement. If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for excellence in finance and taxation, we would like to hear from you.

column2: The Project Procurement Manager has responsibility for coordinating and executing the supply side of project management activities related to complex customer projects.      Mainly focus on T2 and T3 projects; the objectives are to improve the COST, QUALITY, DELIVERY, SPEED and CASH results, for the manufacturing plants and for the fulfillment centers located in APAC.     The Project Procurement Manager works cross-functionally with PSQ (SBU) and Project Management, Order management, Category managers, PSQ, Production & Inventory Controls, IPM and Operations at each stage of the projects - from quotation to award the orders through the manufacture to the delivery to customer.     The Project Procurement Manager is accountable to book supplier s Capacity at quotation stage, to meet net material inflation and Project Budget Targets by working with Category, Supplier Development and Logistics Teams and Suppliers identified on the AVL to build and realize Margin Uplift Opportunities. Project Procurement supports improvement of the conversion rate from Quote to Sale and to drive continuity of the Supply Chain, (Requested Date Service Level), and Margin Uplift.     The Project Procurement & Controls Manager is accountable to manage the Perfect Execution initiatives related to the operational management of vendors. This includes the management of the Center of Excellence located in India or other departments in charge of placing POs to vendors.      In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Promoting solutions with suppliers in AVL during biding phase. Making sure compliance of RFQ with suppliers out of AVL.     Making sure the supplier capacity meets the expectation & the price meet the budget during biding phase.     Working with PIC & key suppliers to achieve margin uplift during pursuit phase and recording/reporting the actual in ProTrack during execution phase.      Making sure the timely delivery for key components from key suppliers (Casting, Actuators, etc.)       Who You Are:       You Continually assess the market potential of an innovative idea or solution. You find and champions the best creative ideas and actively moves them into implementation. You focus efforts on continuous improvement; has a curiosity about identifying and seizing opportunities for alignment and integration. You Continually scscanhe environment for technology breakthroughs. Experiments with a wide range of existing technologies while applying new and emerging options that can enhimproveganizational outcomes.      Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Bachelor s degree or equivalent in Operations, Supply Chain, Engineering, Technical or Business; MBA preferred.     Fluent in English.     Minimum 5 years of professional experience in one or more of the following areas: Operations management, , Sourcing & PM.     Project Management Certification preferred.     Experience with e-sourcing (ARIBA)     Strong capability in planning and analytics, structured problem solving, facilitating and presentation skills.     Persuasive communication, influencing & negotiation skills (internally and externally).     Knowledge of end-to-end supply chain management, global sourcing and logistics optimization initiatives.

column2: This position was designed to direct and control the planning, processing and scheduling activities related to Elliott parts and product orders.    The Buyer Planner II coordinates pre and post-contract requirements in accordance with customer and Elliott specifications.     The general function of the job includes:     utilizing existing and new computer assisted systems, establishing schedule priorities, evaluating shop loads, maintaining the optimum level of inventory to satisfy customer requirements, and taking necessary actions to prevent/resolve overload conditions and delays in the manufacturing process.   The Buyer Planner II will plan and purchase assigned commodities within the commodity management function.    Adhere to Company and Purchasing policies and ensure procurement of material and services at most advantageous value with required quality at required time.    The Buyer Planner will serve as the commodity manager for designated commodities and will work with the Procurement Center of Excellence Manager to develop sourcing plans and strategies. The Buyer Planner will develop and maintain supplier relationships as necessary.   The Buyer Planner is also expected to ensure compliance with the Department Operations Manual in support of Elliott Quality and ISO        BACKGROUND and EXPERIENCE      Bachelor degree or Minimum of 7 years buying and or planning and scheduling experience.   The individual must have an excellent general background in all phases of planning and purchasing as well as commodity management and strategic sourcing.   Must have an excellent knowledge of Company purchasing policies and procedures.   Must possess experience in a heavy manufacturing environment with strengths in production and inventory control, capacity and materials requirements planning, and production activity control.   Must have a high degree of expertise and knowledge of ERP systems utilizing MRP and capacity management.   Must have knowledge of mechanical and geometric drawings, along with an ability to estimate material needs and shop labor hours.   Successful planners possess a background in team oriented environments, a positive attitude, an ability to change, a demonstrated ability to make decisions and a positive perspective regarding the work environment.   Excellent communication skills are required, along with the ability to influence other departments and disciplines to work together to meet the needs of the customer.   Keyboard and personal computer skills are required.        SPECIFIC JOB RESPONSIBILITIES/COMPETENCIES      Maintain and revise as necessary planning charts for individual projects.   Establish intermediate schedule points within the reports, which support the scheduled shipping dates: i.e., drafting, drawing schedules, engineering releases, purchase requisitions, production and assembly and test schedules.   Issue reports/pull signals to sequence work for various departments (i.e. areas, torsional data, drafting, etc.).   Track and expedite those activities previously scheduled to assure the best performance to the schedule.   Manage activities and work load of Production Control personnel and cell controllers in accordance with the established schedules.   Reviews inventory levels to use up or disposition of materials in obsolescence and excess materials from previous job. Maintain a database on excess parts to be re-used on future orders.   Develop priorities for production control and storeroom personnel as to the sequence of which orders are to be picked and issued to the Focus Factory.   Expedite shortages when necessary.   Coordinate with Storeroom and Shipping for the release of ship loose parts and spares.   Manage BOM migration from engineering module to MRP module.   Creates and edits purchase requisitions for unit materials and components, and ensures proper specification, quantity, and required delivery.   Obtains prices by competitive quotations, established market prices, price schedules, etc.   Analyzes prices as to service, quality, FOB, and terms of payment.   Actively participates in cost, quality, FOB, and lead time improvement processes.   Places orders with suppliers to the best advantage of Elliott Group.   Final responsibility for insuring material availablility for assigned commodities.   Interviews supplier representatives and when deemed advisable, arranges for and attends meetings with our engineers or other interested personnel.   Makes necessary supplier plant visitations as required.   Attends seminars and meetings as required.   Administers and negotiates scrap and rework policy.   Prepares reports as required.   Maintains necessary catalog, price, quotation, supplier, and commodity files.   Recommends new sources of supply.   Will participate in Sourcing Council/Groups/Committees, as either member or participant.   Uses good value concepts and works with all departments to obtain maximum benefits.   Practices principles of ethical purchasing and moral codes.   Ability to read, interpret, and recommend changes on drawings and specs.   Researches for technical knowledge of commodities assigned by reading and shop/supplier visits.   Approves price change and invoices in accordance with purchasing policy.   Operates within Union Contract and maintains good employee relations with bargaining and non-bargaining personnel.   Works in accordance with plant and Company rules.   Works in a safe manner.
column13: Procurement, Capacity management, ERP, Purchase, ISO, Manufacturing process, Strategic sourcing, Inventory control, Scheduling, Service quality

column2: The Document Controller (DC) is a vital member of the project support team, who is in-charge of document management. The DC is involved from the conception of the project till the end of the project. During the project life cycle, the DC ensures timely submission of the documents, processing inputs and comments received from customers. Understands the expectations from the PM.       In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Project Execution      Handling multiple project documents.      Preparing transmittals, receiving vendor/customer documentation and distributing internally on time.     Exchange the document to and fro and close the communication loop.      Track documents on a respective project using a documentation system and generate reports on overdue documents and status of project documents.      Expedite approvals and re-submittals as per overdue reports.     Develop style sheet, templates and standard guidelines to be used as a reference in overall formatting of document.     Support the team on numbering and naming philosophy of the document as per standardization.     Manage Revision and document status of the project deliverables.     Expedite internally and externally on customer/vendor documents with respect to the schedule date.     Manage and maintain Vendor documentation.     Being a focal point on the Project documentation/ Support / issues for the entire team.     Arrange shipping of hard copies of documents ( if applicable)     Weekly update on the status of the project & On time delivery of documents to the management.     Clean-up of Project folder after project closeout.     Should have proficiency in compiling of Manufacturing Record Book.     Co-ordinate with project planner for % progress.       Coordination with overseas offices -        Coordination with overseas country offices for Projects/Programs having multiple Purchase Orders      To understand the scope, schedule, document exchange philosophy.     Help Lead engineers to identify documents numbers as per customer philosophy and prepare the Master Document Register.     Training the project team for usage of document exchange tool.     Encourage usage of PMO processes for the documentation.        Other Duties       Perform other additional specific duties, when requested by the business. These will, typically, be strategic in nature but could potentially be anything that the post holder is suitably qualified and experienced to undertake. These duties may be assigned to the person under guidance of a supervisor.       Technical Skills       PMO project execution process     Documentation (DocPro and SharePoint)     Tools     Standards (Quality Management Requirements)     Well versed in MS Office products and with a proficiency in Excel.     Well versed in Adobe writer, Power Point.     Should understand technical writing.     Have prepared few Documents/User Manuals/Procedures independently.       Quality Control & Assurance       Implementation of EEEC IMS processes/documentation as & when required throughout the project.     Adopts to WA quality requirements and Customer s regulatory guidelines     Practices and promotes First time right approach.     Strictly follows GDP (Good Documentation Practices).       Other Duties       Perform other additional specific duties, when requested by the business. These will, typically, be strategic in nature but could potentially be anything that the post holder is suitably qualified and experienced to undertake. These duties may be assigned to the person under guidance of a supervisor.       Who You Are:       You promote high visibility of shared contributions to goals. You quickly and significantly take action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. You actively seek input from pertinent sources to make timely and well-informed decisions. You handle the risk that comes with moving forward when the outcome is not certain.       For This Role, You Will Need:       3-6 years of relevant work experience in the field of Document Controller. Supports project team for document submissions and processing inputs and comments.     Co-ordinates with Project Planners with documentation progress and churn out over-due reports.     Maintain the Master Document Register from the beginning to the end of the project.       Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Any bachelor graduate.

column2: ?  Job title - Production Planning / Production Controller / Production Planning Engineer   The Production Planner is responsible for preparing; prioritizing, modifying & managing daily/weekly/monthly production schedules and ensures that the production targets are achieved.   The key responsibilities are as follows:   Plan & prepare production schedule based on the Production Release Note (PRN), Customer Delivery Dates (CDD) and available/expected resources    Analyses product specifications and plant capacity data and determines the materials, manufacturing process, equipment, and manpower requirement to perform the job. Also incorporates lead times for each activity to meet the shipping schedule   Review materials availability with stores periodically and coordinates with the procurement department to ensure availability of required materials as per the production schedule   Coordinates with subcontractor s for timely receipt of materials as per specification   Addresses and resolves production issues, if any, to minimize delays in production. Expedites operational delays and reschedules plan to meet unforeseen circumstances   Provides the manpower requirement to the Human Resources department and ensures the availability of required manpower for production   Updates all relevant departments of changes to the current production schedule, if any to prioritize their activity based on the current schedule   Works closely with the engineering department to understand the orders in the pipeline and plan production schedule proactively   Apprises QC department of nearing completion status to schedule the final inspection or Third Party Inspection (TPI)   Ensures that the available resources are utilized to their maximum capacity through effective planning & control. Highlight underutilized resources to the plant management   Recommends and implements efficient production techniques, cost reduction initiatives, as well as improve the production process, product quality, and productivity   Plan and maintain minimum stock quantity for fast-moving SKU s in coordination with stores department   Interact with shop floor supervisors daily to understand & resolve issues, if any, regarding manufacturing efficiencies.   Coordinates with packing & logistics for timely dispatch of products to the customer.

The quality assurance manager is the implementation of a quality management system and its effectiveness in meeting business, statutory, legal, and contractual requirements.     Engages with business stakeholders to manage compliance with requirements, supporting a resilient business that manages risks effectively. The role is a key enabler to change and business improvement.       You'll be responsible for:        Delivers delegated elements of an annual business plan to time and budget.       Manages and facilitates external certification audits.       Supports achievement of new certifications where appropriate.       Organises and facilitates internal audits in the audit programme.       Responsible for conducting audits and producing audit reports. Responsible for reviewing management system content for appropriateness, improvement, and implementation.       Participation in the identification of new systems and processes to drive efficiency.       Responsible for ensuring information for quality reports is available, accurate and delivered within agreed timescales.       Responsible to produce communication articles, plans and communication collateral.       Responsible for contributing to all activities reported in management reviews, collating, analysing, and presenting data and key metrics. Responsible for the development and delivery of training.       Monitors performance of a supply chain, including support to suppliers as appropriate through training, guidance, and audits of their QMS capabilities.        Works collaboratively towards the common goal of net zero carbon transition and share responsibility for the proactive identification and management of the associated carbon emissions and reductions during the delivery of work.        About you        Bachelors degree in civil.       Experience for a project of similar nature

column2: To optimally drive initiatives that improve the performance of both Logistics and Stores departments, it is crucial to strategize and deliver on the promised turnaround time for all shipments. This involves strict adherence to International Trade Compliance (ITC) standards, as well as meticulous attention to documentation and packing protocols. Coordination with the Corporate Logistics Team is critical for negotiating the Logistics Service Provider Rate Contract (LSP_RC) and its subsequent implementation at the MSS CoE Pune Hub. Furthermore, it is imperative to improve the benefits from Export Promotion Schemes like Advance Authorization, RoDTEP, DBK, Brand Rate, and to remain vigilant for any new schemes introduced by the government. Compliance with IDPMS, EDPMS, and MTT transactions, along with their respective documentation, is non-negotiable.     Additionally, in this role candidate will supervise inventory management, orchestrate the improvement of stores processes and compliances, maintain operational safety, and actively participate in audit processes.       In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:        Logistics Management:       Support the strategic planning of the organization by developing plans and work processes for the department.     Drive initiatives to bring continuous improvement in the logistics and stores department.     Provide training, coaching, and develop the logistics and stores team. Supervise the development of employees in the department.     Responsible to plan and achieve committed turnaround time for all shipments.     Ensure compliance to ITC and follow documentation and packing guidelines.     Responsible for the planning and executing the budget of the department in cooperation with the supervisor and ensuring adherence to budgets.     Coordinate with Corporate Logistics Team for Logistics Service Provider Rate Contract (LSP_RC) and implementation of the same in MSS CoE Pune Hub.     Increase utilization of Export Promotion Schemes such as Advance Authorization / RoDTEP / DBK / Brand Rate and proactively assess any similar schemes that the government may launch in the future.     Direct involvement in multiple large and critical projects to ensure our shipments packing and dispatches are on time as per our commitment.     Analyze logistics bottlenecks/problems and implement counteractive measures. Resolve any arising problems or complaints.     Ensure to meet compliance guidelines specifically for IDPMS / EDPMS/ MTT transaction and respective documentation.       Stores Management:       Drive initiatives to bring improvement in the Stores department.     Responsible for inventory management.     Implement and Improve Stores processes or Compliances.     Ensure operational safety and participate in audits.       For This Role, You Will Need     :       Experience in Oil & Gas, chemical, petrochemical, valve industry preferred.      Well conversant with national and international INCO Terms / EXIM Policies / Customs Procedures & Handling      Guide in handling Advance authorization / MEIS / DBK / SEIS / TIES / IEIS / EPCG.      Well-versed with Freight Forwarding, CHA Handling, EXIM Docs., Clearances & Local Transportation.      Good Exposure to international countries like USA, Middle East, Europe, Asia Pacific.      Well versed with HSN Coding Systems / CD / IGST / EXIM Data / Bonding_Debonding.      Well conversant with MS office, word & PowerPoint etc.        Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Degree or equivalent experience in mechanical / production engineering or related field with Import Export Diploma / Certified Course / Good Exposure in EXIM in well reputed company.     Validated experience of 15+ years in logistics & store management.

column2: Successful Estimator display strong Estimation, analytical, problem-solving, organizational, and written/oral communication skills. They should be detail-oriented team members who can consistently meet deadlines and possess the ability to work independently as needed. Computer, interpersonal and customer service skills are necessary. The Senior Estimator will be responsible for leading cost estimates and proposals related to design build construction involving transportation and heavy-civil infrastructure. This position will work closely with the Chief Estimator to produce accurate, detailed cost estimates and provide preconstruction support for assigned projects.    Responsibilities and Duties      Work independently or with our Lead Estimator of Burns & McDonnell US office.     Knowledge of DOT bid forms, alternative delivery procurement process, specifications, and bid processes.    Experience with estimating and construction of roadways, highways, bridges, culverts, differin types of pavements, earthwork, grading, and traffic control.   Knowledge of other project scopes such as erosion controls measures, signing, striping, lighting, intelligent transportation systems, traffic signals, and landscaping is preferred.    Lead estimating strategy and implementation efforts.     Review and approve project summary schedules for validity.     Manage workload scheduling for timely completion of deliverables.     Responsible for compliance with estimating methodology to produce high quality estimates.     Lead project team review for estimating quantities and scope of project.     Responsible for reviewing and approving quotes on bonds and insurance.     Review and approve small and disadvantaged business solicitation and evaluations.     Lead subcontractor solicitation and pre-qualification reviews including scope development and reviews.       Responsible for developing specialty and standard equipment pricing.     Review and verify subcontractor bid packages before being transmitted for quotes.     Present the estimate to internal and external clients.     Responsible for the review of final estimates before management review and proposal presentation.       Lead estimating teams for completion of preconstruction services.     Responsible for cost history, database management and estimating process.     Review and approve build-up of general conditions, indirect costs provided by the project management team.       Make final recommendations as to fee, contingency and escalation.     Develop scope and associated hours for the estimating effort.     Develop strategy on contract partnering agreements.     Prepare and present estimating data for the risk review process.     Verify and approve estimates for joint venture reviews.     Review commercial terms and conditions and address risk issues.     Review and validate value engineering items, alternates, and options.     Responsible for the accuracy and validity of estimate clarifications and assumptions.     Review project documents for gaps and overlaps in scope of work.     Train and mentor staff.     Performs other duties as assigned.     Complies with all policies and standards      Qualifications     BE/BTech Full time (Any Engineering Stream, preferably Civil) or equivalent. Applicable experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.    Relevant Experience: 5-15yrs.     Advanced knowledge and understanding of Fixed Price, Time & Materials, Cost Plus Fixed Fee, GMAX, and per Unit contract pricing mechanisms.     Candidate having working knowledge of Advance Excel is preferred.     Interest to learn & develop estimation skills in various Industry.     Excellent written & verbal communication skills.     Ready to work permanently in 2nd shift (12:30 pm to 9:00 PM) to get 3-4 hours overlap with US Office.      Ability to work independently or in groups, think creatively and analytically, and make quick an sound decisions.      Experience with Microsoft Office, HeavyBid, AGTEK,Bluebeam and/or PlanSwift is preferred.     OSHA 10-hour certification Required - can be obtained upon hire.

column2: Turner & Townsend is looking for a Project Lead to support a large-scale, ground-up data center construction project with our prominent technology client   The role will be responsible for all aspects of project delivery, from inception through to commissioning   The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 15 years construction field experience and the ability to be highly effective in a client facing role       Key Elements  :   ?    Pre-construction / Design / Planning:     Work with GC and AE to create and establish the Master Project Schedule, based on the Critical Path and key milestones.   Support establishment of the project budget, including soft costs and hard costs.   Support contract negotiation, typically in concert with the Client s PM and legal counsel   Coordinate Design Team activities.   Ensure AE is completing requirements to meet municipal demands   Coordinate Constructability review of project documents.   Coordinate cost estimates working with subs and other vendors for scope gaps/changes.   Coordinate Value Engineering effort.     Construction:     Manage GC and other directly contracted vendors by working with the onsite Construction Management team.   Ensure quality control process - ensuring compliance with required standards   Support client culture to ensure project and site is ran according to clients EHS policies   Lead procurement activities and coordinate all owner furnished contractor installed equipment   Provide report and tracking of project financials, including change order management & cashflow.   Monitor schedule, tracking and analysis   Ensure document control (track and coordinate addenda, bulletins, new drawing sets, clarifications, etc) process is in place.   Ensure QA/QC is being followed and report any issues/gaps.   Ensure tracking of all key project documents, including submittals, RFIs, change orders, invoices and payments, lien releases.   Coordination and management of all Owner-direct vendors working with supply chain and consultants.     Close Out:     Initiate close out process prior to project completion, typically two to three months in advance with the client doc control team, setting timelines and responsibilities.   Establish close out documentation requirements. Ensure receipt of all close-out documents until completion, including warranties, as-builts, O&M manuals, etc.   Ensure punch list, substantial completion and final completion process through onsite Construction management team.   Negotiate, resolve and close out any outstanding change orders, quality issues or disputes.   Process and track any final invoices, payment applications, retention payments, etc.   Prepare and submit final project accounting and budget.   Assist client in scheduling, coordination and management of all Owner-direct vendors, consultants.    Qualifications          Formal Project Management methods.   Cross functional team participation in a high-tech, dynamic environment   Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.   Proven track record in delivering high-quality programs.   Ability to present to senior management to gain approvals.   Passionate about solving complex challenges within aggressive timelines.   Detail oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment.   Experience in data center construction is preferred.     Preferred Education:      MBA or Bachelors Degree in Construction Management, Business Administration, Project Management (or PMP), Engineering or a related field

column1: Administration and Secretary / EA To MD, MNC, At Thane
column2: KRISHAN LAL SWAMI AND ASSOCIATES, EXECUTIVE SEARCH CONSULTANTS (KLS&A), MUMBAI Job Opportunity - Executive Assistant / Secretary to MD and Administration , At Thane-Mumbai   (At Confidential Client A Global Chemical Manufacturing MNC, Setting Up Operations in India)JOB DESCRIPTION Post: Executive Assistant to Managing Director Location: Thane-Mumbai (Hiranandani Estate, Ghodbunder Road, Thane) Reporting to: Country Head (Managing Director) Gender: Either gender Employment Type: Full-time/PermanentJoining: Immediate Qualification: Any Graduate Experience: Minimum 5 to 10 years of EA/Secretarial experience.  Candidates Profile: A person with good English communication written & spoken, pleasing personality, and 5 to 10 years of experience, preferably as an EA to Director/Top management, having broad-based exposure and ability to shoulder multiple responsibilities spanning Secretarial, and Administration, besides one or more of other corporate functions (like HR/ Payroll, Accounting/Finance, etc.). Should have ability to communicate and coordinate with senior international stake-holders. Prior experience in a similar role in MNC environment will be an advantage. Should be resourceful; and have organising ability to priories work, and deal with multitude of tasks demanding urgent attention. Should be tech savvy.  IT Tech Skills: Proficient in using MS Office Suite-Word, Excel, Power-point; and Video-meeting Apps- MS Teams/Zoom, etc.  Remuneration: Fairly Good Salary as per the candidates background and market standards. ABOUT OUR CLIENT:Our client is a large global MNC in the chemicals manufacturing business with strong brands and leader in its line of business worldwide; and has now decided to enter India and set-up its base to research, manufacture, and market its products in India. A new company is now under formation and its early start-up phase. Planning work in underway for actions to establish a proper organisation with full-fledged, modern infrastructure for R&D, Manufacturing/Supply-chain, Marketing & Sales, Procurement, and other corporate functions over the coming few months. A seasoned professional, who is an industry veteran, has been appointed as the Country Head (MD designate) to set-up and launch the companys business operations in India.We have been requested to assist the Country Head (M.D.) in searching and hiring a dynamic candidate as an Executive Assistant to Country Head (M.D.). This is an important position, and most likely to be the companys first executive/staff member in India. ROLE - OBJECTIVEThe selected EA is expected to be a versatile person, as s/he will assist and support MD in multifarious activities at different stages  from in the current initial start-up phase of hiring and building internal teams of functional heads and key employees, and identifying consultants, to identifying, selecting, acquiring, and furnishing the real estate for office space, building other infrastructure for R&D/QC/supply chain, organising government licences/permissions, appointing distribution partners, importing materials, launching products in India ??to managing full-fledged sales and marketing operations and growing business.Therefore, EA?? is expected to wear different hats as the role priorities and focus will change from one phase to another. Hence this position will excite someone who thrive on doing variety of tasks and have mental bandwidth to deal with new challenges and changing scenarios, and enjoys successful outcomes. This expands one?? potentials for future leadership role.RESPONSIBILITIES: A Mix of responsibilities in Secretarial, Administration, HR/Payroll, and Basic Accounting/FinanceSpecial Responsibilities & Focus in the Early Start-up Phase: Assisting MD in :Building Teams - Hiring first key members of the India leadership team ??functional heads Coordinating with consultants for CVs, coordinate with candidates to arrange interviews with MD.Interact and coordinate with Global HR team for subsequent interview where needed; and complete the hiring process.Arrange issuance of offer letters to selected candidate; follow-up for joining; and make arrangements for on-boarding with necessary facilities (sitting place in temporary co-working office , laptop, internet, phone), and induction.Forming/Registering new company in India, with registration of the trademarks/brand name, and shop and establishment and other registrations ??coordinating and dealing with Indian consultants, and corporate team at global HQ ??general counsel, and finance head.Establishing Office in India ??determining the requirement of office space; dealing with brokers for identifying, visiting/inspecting and shortlisting suitable properties for office space. Finalising office space, and lease agreement in consultation with MD and HQ team. Dealing with Architects and consultant for necessary furnishing of the office space; and arranging relocation of India team to own office. Preparing Salary sheets, and arranging Salary transfers of initial key employees hired; and handling payments of office expenses and employees??reimbursements ??until proper arrangement are made for outsourcing or hiring internal teams. Identifying, negotiating, and finalising arrangements with Outsourcing Agencies for handling service functions like ??Accounting, Payroll, HR, etc., so as to keep the organisation lean in the early stage, till the business and organisation grows justifying having internal departments to handle such services.Making arrangements/setting up infrastructure for R&D, Quality control, Supply Chain and Logistics for handling Importation and distribution of material in India ??in consultation and coordination with MD and HQ.Assist in Product launch, and supply of products to distribution channel/customers.Normal Day-to-day Secretarial / EA Duties:To provide all Secretarial/Executive assistance to the Managing Director (MD); and manage Administration of the MD?? office, including some of the major responsibilities as outlined hereunder: To help plan Itinerary & make Travel arrangements of MD, domestic & international (visa, air-tickets, hotels, & transport). To manage Calendar and Appointments of MD for meetings ??personal, or virtual. To attend and respond to Phone calls received at MD?? office, in a professional manner. And make calls on MD?? office.To courteously receive visiting guests/dignitaries at MD?? office, with hospitality; and make meetings arrangements. Self-correspondence ??to draft and send, and to attend and reply to routine letters/emails/communications received at MD?? office ??in a polite and professional manner.Take notes and draft important correspondence/communications, and minutes of meetings.Research internet, compile and present reports from the information available in public domain ??about the industry and potential client/vendor companies; and preparing Note/PPT presentations.Coordinate and communicate with the company?? India leadership team/functional heads on behalf of MD.Coordinate and communicate with international stake-holders at Global HQ, and other countries. Reviewing incoming MIS/data/performance reports from department heads; compiling and preparing data summaries/brief notes to MD; and preparing Statements/datasheet in excel, Reports, and PPT presentation originating from MD?? office for presentation to Business meetings/Board meetings/International delegates.Manage Administration matters of MD?? office ??including supervising house-keeping and hygiene, pantry, provisions and supplies, office stationery; AMCs; and make arrangements for office meetings and functions, etc. Handling Petty Cash Imprest, preparing and checking vouchers for routine payments of MD?? office. Coordinating timely payments of bills related to MD?? office, including Club payments/subscription renewals, etc.ABOUT US (Consultants):  We, Krishan Lal Swami and Associates (KLS&A), are a Mumbai based boutique Executive Search firm focused on Leadership Hiring for the Board/ C-Suite/ CXO/ Senior Level and the Upper Middle Management level positions across industry sectors and a variety of roles / functions, on pan-India basis. We support some of the top Indian corporate houses and global MNCs in hiring the best human talent. .. We have a talented team of sector specialists and versatile multi-sector search professionals (MBAs from well-known institutes from India and abroad, engineers, cost and management accountants, company secretaries, Ph.D.) with diverse backgrounds, who have collective experience of 200+ man-years in the industry / corporate sector / consulting / recruitment across a myriad of industry domains (e.g. manufacturing; engineering; construction, real estate, infrastructure, EPC; FMCG, pharma, chemical; automobile; hospitality; retail; IT, ITES; shipping, port, logistics; banking, insurance, broking; media, etc.). .. We have been promoted by accomplished top level corporate professionals with more than 70+ man-years of experience in strategy, finance, accounting, tax, legal, HRD, IT, commercial functions. Our founders have worked at the Board of Director level with reputed Indian business houses / conglomerates having businesses across various sectors - engineering, manufacturing, EPC, construction, real estate, conventional and non-conventional energy, international trading, services (banking, logistics, shipping, and ports), education, and media; and thus, have good network and contacts in these fields. .. We strive to excel in our service to all our esteemed clients - big or small. .. We are willing to invest in building special resources/ infrastructure needed for your special projects. For more information, please visit: www.klsanda.com

column2: *Candidate having minimum 15 years' experience in Construction Industry as a Store Manager will only be considered.Job roles and responsibility:Design & execute the Store Operation and strategy to meet our objective.Overseeing the daily operations of site store, making sure it runs smoothly and effectively.Manage all controllable costs to keep operations profitable.Ensure standards for quality, customer service and health and safety are metIdentifies current and future requirements by establishing report with department people to understand service requirements.To issue the material to the execution as per requisition slip authorized by department heads with proper care and handling.Responsible for controlling inventory stock levels and reordering as necessary within Budget.To check all invoices for quantity, quality, rates and maintain record accordingly.To ensure regular availability of inventory in the store, maintains appropriate level of inventory all the time in the store.Manages all aspects of Loss Prevention and adheres to external and internal procedures for theft, inventory management and operations controls.To ensure that the materials are placed in smaller piles and proper stacking to obtain the physical stock at any time of the day with accuracy.Maintains a safety, security and clean store environment by developing and publishing evacuation routes; determining and documenting locations of potentially dangerous materials and chemicals.Hire, train, develop and supervise staff.Ensuring the entry of complete details of required materials by the person requisitioning the same.Receiving all materials in his physical presence to ascertain the quality and quantity as per PO and informing any deviations to the store in chargeEnsuring proper loading/ unloading and storage of all materials to prevent wastage/ pilferage/ theft and time loss (due to logistical failure).Issuing all materials after proper verification of approved document by the competent authority at project level and coordinating with the end user.Preparation of all documents of all store related functions (Computerize & Manually) and keeping all records pertaining to inventory of all materials by posting them in proper books daily.Training all subordinates to create awareness about all kinds of materials utilized at project sites.Preparation of MRN MIN (Material Receipt Note Material Issue Note) through ERP Software.Update all store work on daily basis (MIN , DMR , MRN, GRN, Invoice, Transfers)Etc.Exercise general control over all activities in Stores.Ensure safe keeping both as to quality and quantity of materials.Maintain accurate inventory records.Receive and store documents and confidential files; maintain record of approved documents and confidential files.Reserve a particular material for a specific job when so required and issue materials only in required quantities against authorized requisition notes/material lists.Check the book balances, with the actual physical stock at frequent intervals by way of internal control over wrong issues, pilferage, etc.Monitor and proactively take action in response to site needs/ requests for construction materials.Anticipate and proactively elevate potential challenges/problems.Answers questions regarding procedures and resolve discrepancies regarding receipts, deliveries, warranties, repairs and surplus supply.Monitors and proactively take actions in response to site needs/ requests for construction materialMaintaining the outside area of the stores and yard in a safe clean and tidy condition.Required Candidate Profile:Good Communication Skills & Pleasing personalityGood working knowledge of MS Office & Other software knowledge.Candidate having minimum 15 years' experience in Construction Industry as a Store Manager will only be considered.Excellent organizational and leadership skills.Thorough understanding of Accounts, Inventory management & Budgeting.Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilitiesInterested candidates can share their updated CVs on ahraz.arif@blkashyap.com

column2: If you are a Supply Chain professional and looking for career opportunity, Emerson has an exciting offer to you!    The Strategic Sourcing Engineer is responsible for setting strategies and managing a supply network which will support the Business Units operational goals related to customer satisfaction, operational excellence through Perfect Execution, and financial performance     In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:     Develop and implement sourcing strategies that achieve defined supply chain objectives and prepare and present the strategies at periodic management and executive reviews.   Supplier selection with responsibility for development, qualification, and approval of all assigned suppliers.   Lead E-Sourcing Negotiation events including: spend analysis; RFQ strategy; supplier selection; bid analysis; award strategy; and implementation   Contract negotiation, administration, and compliance which meet Emerson standards including provisions for price, delivery, payment terms, and Perfect Execution performance metrics.    Identify and drive projects to meet NMI plan and Cost Reduction Targets.   Liaison between suppliers, Quality Assurance, Engineering and others as necessary to support cost containment and cost reduction initiatives.    Manage the strategic business relationship with key preferred suppliers including periodic performanperformance evaluationse reviews.   Stay Know the latesturrent with overall market conditions both from a supply base and raw material perspective. Understand the cost drivers for assigned categories.   Manages supply chain sustainability with a focus on capacity, tooling life cycle management, material availability, supply risk assessment, and trade compliance   Assess supplier capabilities, perform cost benefit analysis, issue resolution, risk mitigation and contingency planning.   Supports Commodity Managers in implementing commodity plans.   Strong ability to engage internal external partners collaboratively to derive solutions for any projects/ assignment tasked.   Supports purchasing metrics in terms of inventory, supplier service levels, shortages management etc       For This Role, You Will Need:     Minimum 5 to 6 years of proven experience in the Strategic Sourcing Supply Chain Management.   Strong Organizational and Analytical Skills.   Excellent Negotiations Skills.   Ability to comprehend and interpret engineering drawings, quality systems requirements and customer specifications   Ability to understand component requirements and communicate requirements to suppliers   Proven communication and collaboration skills enabling effective working relationships   Solid understanding on MRP (Oracle) and MS Office software like MS Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint.   Ability to lead change and alignment on new concepts and approaches through persistence, self-motivation, follow-through, and commitment.   Must be willing to travel and possess skills to facilitate communications and progress initiatives while traveling     Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:     Degree / Diploma or equivalent in Engineering, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or any related field.   Knowledge on Lean Techniques, ISO 9002 Quality System and Inventory Management will be an added advantage.

column2: Job Title: Head of Sales - Lubricants (Nigeria)Location: NigeriaExperience Required: Africa Sales Experience with a Technical Educational BackgroundJob Summary:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Sales with a technical educational background to lead our Lubricants division in Nigeria. The ideal candidate should have a strong sales and business development track record in Africa, coupled with a deep understanding of the technical aspects of lubricants. As the Head of Sales, you will play a pivotal role in driving revenue growth, expanding market share, and nurturing client relationships within the Nigerian lubricants industry.Key Responsibilities:Sales Strategy: Develop, implement, and continually refine a comprehensive sales strategy for the Lubricants division in Nigeria, aligning it with the company's objectives.Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and motivate a high-performance sales team, offering guidance and training to ensure that sales targets are consistently met or exceeded.Market Analysis: Conduct thorough market research and analysis to identify opportunities, market trends, and competitive factors affecting the lubricants industry in Nigeria.Technical Expertise: Utilize your technical background to guide the sales team on product specifications, benefits, and applications, as well as to provide technical support to customers.Customer Engagement: Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, distributors, and partners, while also exploring new opportunities to expand the customer base.Revenue Growth: Drive sales growth by crafting and executing innovative sales plans, including pricing strategies, promotions, and product positioning.Forecasting and Reporting: Develop precise sales forecasts, monitor performance against targets, and provide regular progress reports to senior management.Budget Management: Manage the sales budget effectively, ensuring efficient resource allocation and cost control.Compliance and Ethics: Ensure that all sales activities comply with company policies, local regulations, and ethical standards.Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments, such as marketing, operations, and supply chain, to ensure a seamless and customer-centric sales process.Training and Development: Implement training programs for the sales team to enhance product knowledge and sales skills.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in a technical field, such as engineering or chemistry. MBA is a plus.A minimum of 15 years of sales and business development experience with a strong focus on the African market.Technical proficiency and a deep understanding of lubricants and related products.Exceptional leadership and management skills, with the ability to inspire and lead a sales team.Strong communication and negotiation skills.Proficiency in using CRM and sales software.In-depth knowledge of the lubricants industry and its specific challenges in Nigeria.Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities.Results-oriented with a focus on achieving and exceeding sales targets.High ethical standards and commitment to compliance.Adaptability to navigate the dynamic business environment in Nigeria.If you meet the qualifications and are excited about the opportunity to lead our Lubricants sales division in Nigeria with your technical expertise, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and accomplishments.
column13: Lubricant Sales, Industrial Sales, Automobile Sales

column2: A clear understanding of the purpose of the documentation they are preparing.   Good English communication skills and interpersonal skills.   Proven working experience in a construction company.    Job Responsibilities and Duties       Strategic Duties      Establish procurement strategies for acquisition, receiving, and tracking of project materials with Construction management that optimize quality, cost, and timely delivery criteria. Work collaboratively with Construction management and the Design team to coordinate supplier selection, credit, and terms, track supplier performance standards, and conduct the ongoing evaluation. Collaborate with management in the negotiation of contracts and lines of credit with suppliers and subcontractors.      General Administrative Duties      Conducts periodic meetings with subordinates to ensure that priorities are clear and the workflow is running smoothly as per agreed plans at the beginning of each year Prepares periodic reports regarding the department activities and achievements to be submitted to the Logistics Manager on monthly basis or when required Identifies human resources requirements for the department according to human resources planning best practices and market norms Recommends appropriate development and training plans for subordinates and evaluating their effectiveness through monitoring the results delivered and employee s performance Carries out performance appraisals for subordinates according to the planned schedules and recommending necessary actions as per the adopted procedures Assigns a coverage person to carry out the responsibilities of the position whenever the need arises such as travel, out of office for personal or business need Performing other duties related to the job as assigned by the Logistics Manager      Technical Duties      Prepare, maintain and review purchasing records, produce management reports, track the status of requisitions, contracts, and orders, approve bills for payment, calculate the cost of orders, assign invoices to the appropriate accounts, and monitor in-house inventory transfer for project consumption. The procurement manager also determines if inventory quantities for commonly used items are sufficient for the needs of the company and orders more supplies as needed. Conduct research via the Internet, catalogs, trade publications, and trade shows to identify potential suppliers. Interview prospective suppliers either face-to-face or over the phone to determine prices, discounts, terms, etc. Create spreadsheets with vendor product or service comparisons of prospective suppliers to support management decisions Prepare, maintain and review purchasing files and records, price lists, the status of requisitions, contracts, and orders, locate suppliers, approve bills for payment, monitor subcontractor performance, calculate the cost of orders, ensure invoices are charged to the appropriate accounts and monitor inventory transfer forms for bookkeeping records.

column2: 1. Consumable Purchase (Indirect)     Identification of suppliers who are dealing consumable items and seek quotation.     For same items, check SAP for better rates across Varroc Plants and explore horizontal deployment     Assess the supplier for capability to ensure supplies in timely manner.     Do the negotiation for rate finalization, Initiate & follow up for PO release (based on DOA matrix &   Purchase SOP)     Identify Repeat Purchase items (receipt of which is more than 5 times in a year) & initiate Open PO process   to Corp.SCM (NON Bom) team     Enter into YOY rate discounts agreements / Credit notes based on incremental spend over last 2 years     Based on above, make a supplier rationalization plan & implementation   2. Indirect/Services Purchase (Indirect)     Execute standard contracts fixed by corporate by generating PO as per PR received from department.     Do the sourcing as per DOA - capex procurements up to 5 lac, Indirect purchase up to 2 Lac.     Identify, negotiate and finalize rates for Indirect purchases/services, finalize the delivery terms as per end   user requirement.     Create non-standard contract (at plant level) on an on-going basis   If service value is more than Rs.2 lacs per year, then initiate Open Service contract with Corp.SCM team     Co-ordinate with supplier for packing related development activities.   Support plant team for creating PO s for other Indirect related services from time to time   3. BOM Purchase (Direct)     Part scheduling and releasing tentative schedule before the start of month and firm schedule in 1st week to   ensure supplier readiness. (1 month firm & 2 months tentative)     Ensure follow up with supplier to ensure on time delivery to avoid line stoppage and premium freights     Coordinate with supplier in case of customer complaint, IHR, warranty complaint for action plan, ensure   effective implementation through close monitoring to reduce supplier PPM.     In case of any tool issue or supplier issue, try to solve it at plant level. If not, escalate to Corp.SCM     Coordinate with supplier/sub supplier in case of material shortage to avoid line loss.   In case of frequent issues, recommend change of SOB to Corp.SCM.     For every rate amendment of Directed suppliers, co-ordinate with Corp.SCM for timely amendment     Monitoring inventory stock at supplier end as per the terms of agreement to avoid surprises.     Communicate supplier with Corp.SCM in loop in case material mix-up, material shortage & rework, raise   debits to avoid recurrence. Make proper MOM and circulate to all     To maintain RM + BOP Parts inventory as per Plant target. In case of any stock variations, get it corrected   immly. This should be every month activity     Participate actively in monthly supplier Q&D meetings & involve other Plant CFT to resolve issues, if any   4. Coordinate overall purchase activity for the plant section (Direct)     Coordinate with corporate for any shortages and required support for dealing with defaulting vendor to   ensure uninterrupted supply.     Monitoring material inward and consumption to control raw material inventory cost.     Attend daily morning meeting, red bin meeting to coordinate purchase related points with production,   quality.     Ensure top 80% suppliers Account reco every year with co-ordination with plant finance     Monitor line loss due to material shortage and provide corrective action plan to minimize impact and avoid   recurrence.     Initiate frequent meetings with Corp.SCM team (BOM & Non BOM) to discuss pending issues, if any     Ensure proper documentation as per IATF /OSHAS to ensure audit compliance.     Participate & provide input to PPC & production for daily production planning.     Guide and support team in case of material failure analysis.     Coordinate with NPD team for common parts sourcing during new project trials and subsequent planning   for mass production supplies.   5. Import item procurement for section     Scheduling of import items in 1-month (firm) & 2 month (tentative) format, prepare weekly shipment plan   to ensure timely supplies and control inventory.     Creation of PO based on Contract made by Corp.SCM, Coordinate with supplier for dispatches as per   shipment plan, Ensure MIRO & MIGO for Import items.   6. Supplier & Part Development     Participate & assist Corporate CD team in supplier PPAP in case new development/New supplier to   expedite development.     Work out changeover date in case of VAVE parts, communicate to customer/PPC to avoid obsolesce cost.     Monitoring & Co-ordination of ECN implementation at supplier end to improve product quality.     Coordinate with Supplier and Stores to Implement packing improvements.

We are looking for a RTU, SCADA Service Engineer in Oil and Gas domain to work with our ETS Team    In this role you will work independently and as a part of a team to extend support on domestic or international sites for configuration, testing, engineering, commissioning, SAT etc    We value autonomy, self-reliance, fast movers, a passion for robust and maintainable tests, and above all, the ability to ship a quality product         In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       RTU/SCADA precommisioning, Commissioning, SAT etc.     Demonstrate high level of flexibility, commitment, and ownership. Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:         Degree in Instrumentation Control / Electrical / Electronics Engineering     Basic understanding of networking protocols and concepts     Capable of describing and documenting for overall Project strategy     Contribute to and help maintain the engineering team     Excellent written and verbal communication skills      Innovative mind set. column2: Purchasing(DM/IDM/B2B) is one of most meaningful tasks in supply chain department to support MSOL (P) Operations manufacturing products to satisfy customer demand.     We need a capable and energetic leader with open mind and abundant momentum to lead and empower a group of highly motivated Purchase executives of strategic commodities /products/services, collaborating with cross functions groups across MSOL, AP and Global to ensure material availability and inventory with optimized Key Performance Measurements achievement to gain business growth   .        In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:      Material availability, inventory and cost objectives      Develop, execute purchasing strategy (DM/IDM/B2B) to ensure material availability along with business objectives of cost reduction, inventory reduction.    Lead buyer group to minimize material shortage probability and optimize inventory control, to meet and continuously improve critical metric goals of Total ITO and RAW Inventory    To lead team to work with suppliers on continuous improvement of overall performance by collaborating with groups of IPO, SPE, and Global Commodity Manger    To lead procurement team to continuously improve work process efficiency, to optimize system purchasing parameters set up, adopt and develop JDE/ Oracle application tools by aligning and collaborating with Global and AP supply chain organization      Plan/issue PO to suppliers/coordinate ,Follow-up, or expedite with suppliers to ensure needs are met      Provide forecast to suppliers via i-Supplier Portal      Send global delivery performance to suppliers and work with non-performing suppliers for improvement      Work with suppliers to improve their lead-time to support inventory and customer service objectives      Work with suppliers to improve their flexibility to support surge and project orders      Review slow moving, excess inventory on a regular interval and take actions to improve      Manage purchases to optimize logistic, inventory costs for better cost containment      Work with internal stake holders for better planning, purchasing ,coordinating IDM (Capex/services) for best cost optimization and meet delivery schedule as per customer need.      Work on B2B process cadence, metrics alignment/strengthening processes in line with AP and drive for continuous improvement with Intraco factories.      Negotiate, maintain, monitor and regularly evaluate relationships and contracts with suppliers      work closely with Oracle team during oracle implementation for all purchasing processes mapping, identifying gaps and process improvement.      Liaising with IPO (International purchasing Office) for all in WAMS business systems (Oracle/JDE/others) purchasing processes/metrics alignment and drive the same at site      Administer commercial policies/procedures, compliance, audits      Administer global contracts, agreements, procurement policies and terms/ conditions for purchases      Maintain purchasing parameter/std cost/new part set up/new supplier      Submit procurement reports (supplier Delivery Performance, cost saving, inventory on hand, etc)   to management and commodity managers      Ensure purchases are in compliance with trade import/export, purchasing policies      work on Digitization initiatives with AP DII team to implement DII project for better cost, speed, productivity, accelerate DII deployment to impact material availability, raw inventory optimization and work efficiency improvement.      Training of new suppliers for i-Portal      Strive for continuous improvement and pro-active in all      Perform any other tasks as and when assigned      support business and org challenges as on when come    to lead development thru approaches of recruitment, training, mentor to make entire team be proficient to meet company strategic business growth.          For This Role, You Will Need:      Bachelor s Degree with Minimum 8-12 years of relevant purchasing experience . Technical knowledge and competence in relevant experience, in a manufacturing environment.      Preferably with MRP Knowledge      Office Software Application Skills      Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.      Preferable with working knowledge in Lean presentations and project management Techniques      Knowledge of ISO Quality System and Working knowledge of Supplier and Process Audits      Passionate in team engagement and development, Organization and team skill to lead purchasing      Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Excellent communication skills including presentations and negotiation    Leadership experience by supervising group of 5+ is preferred

column2: 1.    RFQ stage      As per BOM received from RFQ Team, send RFQ to suppliers and get part and tooling quote from LTS suppliers.    Compare quote and send for review to HOD / SCM team.    Discuss and get feasibility points from supplier and conclude with R&D team.    Finalize supplier and submit cost to RFQ team for review.      2.    Identification of right supplier      After receipt of drawing, send RFQ to LTS suppliers for Mass Production Part feasibility, Capacity Review.    Capacity Assessment, review capacity & check for fulfillment of NPD s additional requirement.    Evaluate the supplier based on capability, on time delivery and cost.    Submit the documents to HOD/ SCM & get the details of final supplier from SCM.      3. Tool and Part development      Make Capex Approval sheet, after approval make PR & give commercial and tech details to SCM for PO.    Do Mass production feasibility with suppliers after agreement on DFM with R&D and suppliers give clearance for part /tool development.    Tracking tool development activities wrt to Time plan and track development.    Frequent visit tool manufacturer and ensure tool making is done as per timeline.    Conducting Tool trials and generating Sample inspection reports to get approval from R&D.    Conduct first trial sample at suppliers end. Ensure all necessary reports along with samples and submit to plant.    Take up with Plant QA for full layout dimensional and other reports .    Discuss with R&D for any deviation, do fitment trial, and disposal of the report after discussion with R&D , Plant QA.    After dimensional clearance on parts, Ensuring Tool GRN activity with plant.    Coordinate with finance for tool payment clearance after receipt of approval from Quality.      4. PPAP & Handover      Do PPAP activity along with NPD quality at supplier manufacturing site .    Conduct pre PPAP audit to check suppliers readiness on jigs, fixtures, measuring gauges, and machine availability    Ensuring closure of PPAP audit points with supplier for SOP readiness    Get PSW signoff from NPD QA after closure PPAP audit points and part qualification.    Communicate and get PO done after PSW approval.    Ensure minimum 3 months of regular production supplies and meet the PPM target    Work closely with CFT to understand any QA issues in built or MFG and ensure smooth ramp up as per customer.      5. Proto development      Proto supplier selection & cost settlement for required batch.    PR release for proto part, get PO released from SCM with commercial settlement.
column13: QA, GRN, NPD, PPAP, RFQ, SCM, HoD, Cost, Tool making, Auditing

column2: Lead high profile assignments on the analyst team in India focused on the iron & steel and other capital intensive infrastructure sectors across the Indian subcontinent and the Middle East.   Serve the C-suite in financial institutions, investors and promoters in answering owner-oriented questions on capital allocation, operating efficiency, technical feasibility, and investment phasing.   Translate multiple engineering inputs into financial metrics affecting P&L and cash flow, and frame capital investment alternatives for decision making.   Develop and maintain industry and competitive cost database from worldwide plant infrastructure, production, material price movements, supply chain understanding and industry trends.   Help develop, maintain and standardize financial and operational models to be applied for delivering customer solutions quickly and productively.         Skill Set:     Costing, Financial Analysis, Financial Modelling, Budgeting, Business Optimisation         Experience:     15 Years of experience as a financial analyst or CPA/CFA with substantial exposure to capital intensive sectors (iron & steel, power, oil & gas, etc.), formal Finance training at the university level (an MBA in Finance desirable), deep modelling experience in Excel, experience making executive presentations to Senior Management are required. An Engineering Degree in Metallurgy or Mech E is a plus, but not required. To succeed in this role, and interest in understanding steel making processes and translating that into financial metrics of efficiency and profitability for owners is a must.

column2: Role & responsibilities  - The Head of   ESG will be responsible for driving the development, implementation, and    oversight of Environmental, Social, and Governance initiatives within the   organization. This   position plays a crucial role in ensuring that the company   operates in a sustainable and socially  responsible manner, aligning with   global ESG standards and best practices.- Develop a comprehensive ESG strategy aligned with the organization's overall business objectives. Identify and prioritize key ESG issues relevant to company's stakeholders.-  Identify and manage environmental impact areas, such as carbon emissions, waste management, resource consumption, and renewable energy integration.- Establish and maintain robust governance frameworks, ethics policies, and accountability mechanisms to ensure compliance and responsible business practices.- Lead the integration of ESG considerations into various business functions, including finance, operations, human resources, and supply chain. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to embed ESG principles into decision-making processes and daily operations.- Engage with internal and external stakeholders, including investors, customers, employees, and regulatory bodies, to promote transparency and address sustainability concerns.- Oversee the preparation and publication of ESG reports and disclosures in compliance with industry standards and regulations. - Identify and assess ESG-related risks and opportunities that may impact the business. Work with risk management teams to develop mitigation strategies and enhance resilience.- Stay abreast of evolving ESG regulations, standards, and best practices.- Ensure the company's ESG activities align with relevant frameworks and guidelines.- Conduct training programs to enhance employee awareness and understanding of ESG issues. - Foster a culture of sustainability and responsibility throughout the organization. Preferred candidate profile  - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., sustainability, environmental science, business, etc.);   advanced degree preferred.- Proven experience in ESG, sustainability, or related roles, with a track record of successful  strategy development and implementation for minimum of 8 to 10 years.- Strong understanding of global ESG frameworks, standards, and reporting requirements. - Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills. Leadership experience, with the ability to collaborate across functions and drive change within an organization. Job Location : Worli - Dadar - MumbaiInterested candidates kindly share CV to swapnil.sarvankar@cgglobal.comPerks and benefits
column13: Social, Environmental, ESG, Governance, ESG frameworks, ESG reports

column2: Role & responsibilities:  Identify, evaluate, and select suppliers, subcontractors, and vendors for MEP materials, equipment, and services. This involves researching potential suppliers, negotiating terms and prices, and establishing long-term relationships to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement.Receive and review material requisitions from project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to determine procurement requirements. Collaborate with internal teams to understand specifications, quantities, and delivery schedules.Prepare and issue Requests for Quotation (RFQs) to selected suppliers, subcontractors, and vendors. Evaluate received quotations based on factors such as price, quality, lead time, and terms of delivery. Coordinate with relevant departments for technical evaluation and selection criteria.Generate purchase orders (POs) based on approved quotations and negotiated terms. Ensure accuracy of PO details, including quantities, specifications, prices, delivery dates, and terms of payment. Communicate POs to suppliers and subcontractors and track order status until delivery.Negotiate contracts, terms, and conditions with suppliers and subcontractors to secure favorable pricing, payment terms, and service levels. Maintain contract documentation and ensure compliance with contractual obligations throughout the procurement process.Monitor inventory levels of critical MEP materials and equipment to prevent stockouts and delays in project execution. Coordinate with project teams to forecast material requirements and maintain optimal inventory levels to meet project schedules.Monitor supplier performance, including delivery timeliness, product quality, and adherence to contractual agreements. Address any issues or discrepancies promptly and work with suppliers to implement corrective actions and improve performance.Analyze procurement costs, expenditures, and budget variances to identify cost-saving opportunities and optimize procurement processes. Work closely with finance and project management teams to ensure alignment with project budgets and financial objectives.Coordinate logistics and transportation arrangements for incoming materials and equipment deliveries to project sites. Ensure timely and efficient transportation while minimizing costs and risks associated with transit.Ensure compliance with company policies, procurement procedures, industry regulations, and legal requirements related to procurement activities. Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records, documentation, and reports for audit purposes.Overall, as a Purchase Executive in an MEP contracting company, your role is critical in facilitating the procurement of materials, equipment, and services essential for successful project execution. column2: Role & responsibilities  Candidate would be solely responsible for managing and controlling Stores for all engineering material. This includes real-time & correct Record Keeping, Manpower Management, Material Handling, Inventory Management (In-ward & Out-ward), Accounting standards & compliances (like GST) w.r.t. material at stores, Stock reconciliation in Stores. Candidate is expected to be well versed with material inward and outward processes. Real time reports should be available w.r.t materials, so as related activities are always done with correct data.Inventory Management: One of the primary responsibilities of a Stores In charge is to efficiently manage the inventory of the organization. This includes keeping a record of all incoming and outgoing items, ensuring accuracy in stock levels, and maintaining proper stock replenishment processes. The In charge should regularly monitor inventory levels, identify slow-moving or obsolete items, and implement effective inventory control techniques. Stock Planning and Procurement: The Stores In charge is responsible for planning stock requirements by analyzing sales trends, understanding customer needs, and reviewing historical data. They must collaborate with purchase departments to ensure timely procurement of goods and raw materials. The In charge must maintain a good rapport with suppliers, negotiate prices, and ensure the quality of incoming materials. Storehouse Operations and Maintenance: Another crucial role of a Stores Incharge is to oversee the overall operations and maintenance of the storehouse. This includes organizing the layout of goods, ensuring their proper storage and handling, conducting regular stock audits, and optimizing the space to maximize storage capacity. Additionally, the Incharge should implement safety standards, provide proper equipment to staff, and maintain cleanliness and hygiene in the storehouse. Documentation and Reporting: Accurate and timely documentation is crucial in any organization. A Stores Incharge is responsible for maintaining records related to stock receipts, issues, returns, and transfers. They must generate regular reports on various aspects such as stock levels, stock movement, and inventory valuation. These reports are vital for decision-making, identifying discrepancies, and developing strategies for efficient supply chain management. Team Management: A Stores In charge is also responsible for managing the store staff. This involves hiring and training new personnel, providing guidance and support, conducting performance appraisals, and motivating team members to achieve their targets. Effective communication and delegation of tasks are essential to ensure smooth and efficient store operations.Preferred candidate profile Any Graduate, Diploma in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil Engineering3 - 6 years experience Engineering , Retail & Real estate industry would be preferable or else any industry Contact:Interested Candidates kindly share your resume onanishaoasishrconsultant@gmail.comAnisha ShahSG OASIS
