column2: Executive Assistant (EA):Administrative Support: EAs primarily provide high-level administrative support to executives, often at the C-suite level    They manage schedules, coordinate meetings, and handle communications on behalf of the executive they support    Calendar Management: EAs are responsible for managing the executive's calendar, scheduling appointments, and ensuring they are organized and punctual    Travel Arrangements: They make travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodations, and transportation, for the executive    Communication: EAs handle incoming and outgoing communications, including email, phone calls, and correspondence, and often serve as a gatekeeper for the executive    Meeting Coordination: They coordinate and prepare materials for meetings, including agendas, reports, and presentations    Confidentiality: EAs handle sensitive information and maintain a high level of discretion    Task Delegation: They help the executive manage their workload by delegating tasks to appropriate team members and ensuring follow-up    Project Support: EAs may assist in managing special projects, conducting research, and preparing reports    Technical Assistant (TA):Technical Support: TAs provide technical support and assistance to individuals or teams in various technical fields, such as IT, engineering, or research    Problem Solving: They help troubleshoot technical issues, identify solutions, and assist with resolving problems    Technical Documentation: TAs may be responsible for creating, updating, or organizing technical documentation, such as manuals, procedures, or reports    Equipment Maintenance: They assist in the maintenance and repair of technical equipment, tools, or systems    Data Management: TAs often handle data entry, data analysis, and data management tasks    Technical Research: TAs conduct research, gather technical information, and assist in technical projects or experiments    Laboratory Assistance: In scientific or research settings, TAs provide support to scientists or researchers, which may include setting up experiments, conducting tests, and recording data

column2: As a transport manager, your role involves overseeing the transportation operations of a company or organization    You are responsible for planning, organizing, and managing the movement of goods, materials, or people efficiently and effectively     Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with the role of a transport manager:     Strategic Planning: Developing transportation strategies and policies that align with the organization's objectives    This includes determining the most cost-effective and efficient transportation routes and modes of transportation    Fleet Management: Managing the company's fleet of vehicles, including procurement, maintenance, and scheduling    This involves ensuring that vehicles are in good working condition, properly licensed, and meet safety and regulatory requirements    Logistics Coordination: Coordinating with suppliers, customers, and other stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of goods or services    This may involve coordinating multiple transportation modes, such as road, rail, air, or sea, to optimize efficiency    Route Optimization: Analyzing transportation routes and developing strategies to minimize costs, reduce fuel consumption, and improve delivery times    This may involve using route planning software, considering traffic patterns, and utilizing real-time data to make informed decisions    Compliance and Regulations: Staying up to date with transportation laws, regulations, and compliance requirements    Ensuring that the company operates in accordance with relevant legislation, such as driver hours, vehicle weight limits, and environmental regulations    Cost Control: Monitoring transportation costs, analyzing expenses, and implementing cost-saving measures    This may include negotiating contracts with transportation providers, optimizing fuel consumption, and reducing maintenance and repair costs

column2: We are looking for a Supply Chain Specialist to work with our Global Supply Chain organization   This role has responsibility for implementing the development and implementation of global regional supply chain plans, initiatives and activities that drive flawless Cost Optimization programs for a Strategic Business Unit (SBU)   This position also has responsibility for working across a highly matrixed organization of Product Managers, Supplier Development, and PIC managers (Production and Inventory Controls) to meet the COST, QUALITY, DELIVERY, SPEED and CASH targets for the manufacturing plants and fulfillment centers and delivering the Net Savings Targets for the business for the selected categories         In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:     Work collaboratively across Supply Chain team as well as with internal and external suppliers, departments and strategic business units to create end-to-end supply chain plans.   Develop and implement robust, accurate and on-time supply chain plans by implementing the product supply chain processes across the Understand - Design - Plan and Implement methodology   Plan for growth and capacity requirements, leverage on supplier capabilities for on-time-to-market, cost and launch readiness   Create cohesive supply chain programs and plans with identifiable critical path, task dependencies, and major breakthroughs, and manages the approved plans and schedules.   Complete Initial RFQ Analysis and prepare a TCO (Total Cost Of Ownership) Model and review with Partners to evaluate cost down opportunity.   Track supply chain metrics to measure cost, service, quality and efficiency tied to Project budgets.     Who You Are:     You promote high visibility of shared contributions to goals. You quickly and significantly take action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. You actively seek input from pertinent sources to make timely and well-informed decisions. You handle the risk that comes with moving forward when the outcome is not certain.    For This Role, You Will Need:     Bachelor s degree or equivalent or above in Supply Chain Management or Mechanical Engineering.    Fluent in English, both Oral and Writing.   Strong negotiation and project management skills within multi-disciplinary teams.    At least 5 years related functional working experience in Supply, Engineering, or Operations. Big Sourcing Program and/or Project leadership experience of cross-functional teams, proof of record of successful projects will be desirable. Experience in Manufacturing industry environment preferred.   Capability in planning and analytics, structured problem solving, facilitating and presentation skills.   Persuasive communication, influencing negotiation skills (internally and externally).   Extensive contract negotiation management, strong supplier management experience. Knowledge of end-to-end supply chain management, global / best cost country (BCC) sourcing and logistics optimization initiatives.     Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:     Experience in e-Sourcing preferred.   Experience and knowledge of manufacturing and lean preferred.   Experience with core software applications (ERP), preferably with SAP or Oracle.   Microsoft Office skills, Excellent at using Excel on data analysis

We are looking for a RTU, SCADA Service Engineer in Oil and Gas domain to work with our ETS Team    In this role you will work independently and as a part of a team to extend support on domestic or international sites for configuration, testing, engineering, commissioning, SAT etc    We value autonomy, self-reliance, fast movers, a passion for robust and maintainable tests, and above all, the ability to ship a quality product         In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       RTU/SCADA precommisioning, Commissioning, SAT etc.     Demonstrate high level of flexibility, commitment, and ownership. column2: Summary of Job    We are seeking an experienced analytics professional and smart leader to oversee analytics on our native SaaS (Software as a Service) based suite of products (NAVIK) and a collection of analytics-based micro-services (NAVIK AI Platform). This role will essentially involve influencing product strategy through data-driven insights and A/B testing efforts focused on improving business impact through our products. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, independent, highly analytic, and finds problem solving exhilarating. She/he will be able to thrive with a high rate of change, while working with multi-faceted data. She/he will report to the Engagement Manager of Products and Innovation.   MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE    4-8 years of rich experience in implementing Machine/Statistical Learning solutions to complex business problems at scale      Rich experience in various Machine Learning techniques like Regression, Classification, Ensemble of Decision Trees (Bagging, Boosting, Random Forest etc.), Support Vector Machines, Artificial Neural Networks, Clustering, Dimension Reduction etc.      Intermediate-level proficiency (coding, scripting and prototyping skills) in Python or R    DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE    Bachelor s/Master s degree in Computer Science OR Master s degree in Statistics/Economics/Business Economics / Econometrics / Operations Research      Experience in implementing the advanced techniques/methods like Recommender Systems (Collaborative Filtering, Matrix Factorization etc.), Association Rule Learning, Convolutional Neural Network, Recurrent Neural Network, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Reinforcement Learning (RL), Time-series Analysis and Bayesian methods      Experience in productionizing the machine learning models for analytics-based SaaS (Software as a Service) products      Familiarity with A/B site testing and evaluation      Expert-level proficiency (good coding, scripting and prototyping skills) in Python or R or both      Fair understanding of distributed computing in clusters, especially using R/Python      Knowledge and familiarity with the Big Data stack: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Map Reduce and other Big Data tools and technologies      Operating knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, especially EMR, EC2, S3, and AWS CLI)      Understanding of database management systems like those of RDBMS, NoSQL, MongoDB etc.      Knowledge of one or more domains: Telecommunication, Consumer Electronics, CPG, Online Media, BFSI, Healthcare, Logistics, Manufacturing etc.    Specific Responsibilities    Conceptualize, design and deliver high-quality solutions and insightful analysis on a variety of projects ranging in both complexity and scope      Conduct research and prototyping innovations, data and requirements acquisition, solution scoping and architecture, consulting clients or client-facing teams on advanced statistical/machine learning problems      Conduct analytic deep-dives of critical business issues that impact performance and translate the analyses into actionable recommendations      Collaborate with product managers in defining clear business problems and corresponding metric definition, and communicate performance analysis, findings and recommendations      Partner with Data Engineering, Frontend Engineering and Web Design teams to collaborate and improve the product solutions      Lead and groom the pool of data scientists for solving complex problems using data science      Manage the development of NAVIK suite of products and NAVIK AI Platform.    Sample Projects      Following is the indicative list of projects that Absolutdata Labs is engaged in:        NAVIK MarketingAI       Hyper-personalization and customization of product-integrated email/SMS campaigns       NAVIK SalesAI       Creation of Weekly Game Plan for Salespersons to enhance their sales effectiveness       NAVIK AI Platform       Recommendation of optimal SKU assortment        SKU volume prediction       NAVIK Signals       Garner competitive and category intelligence, identify existing and upcoming trends using unstructured data       Research & Development       Incorporation of the applications of advanced ensemble machine learning techniques (Stacked Generalization/ Blending etc.) into the NAVIK products        Enhancement of optimization algorithms in the analytics backend of NAVIK products etc.

column2: A project manager s role is to take on the responsibility for a specific project or several projects within an organization. The Project Manager needs to make sure that a project runs smoothly and stays on schedule and update the progress of their project regularly to the upper management. They are in charge of planning, budgeting, monitoring, and reporting the project with the use of various project management methodologies as well as the processes set in place by Nash Tech Labs.      MANDATORY SKILLS       Good communication and presentation skills.      Ability to express technical and non-technical concepts clearly and concisely.      Good understanding of our services and products, and the ability to facilitate innovation in our concepts, designs, products, and services. Excellent organizational skills to meet predetermined goals and set priorities.      Innate drive to innovate, succeed and be proactive.      Strong organizational talents and ability to work under pressure and in new environments.      Project Manager is expected to have time management skills and comply with the predetermined project plan.      People Management is mandatory for the project manager as he/she will be working together with a group of engineers, directing them on successfully achieving project goals.      Be the architect and design a project which mitigates risk and completes a project as per requirements given by a project manager.       TECHNICAL SKILLS       Experience in hardware design life cycle.      Develops products by studying applicable standards.      Experience in hardware product process flow.       ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES         Feasibility Study:    drive project(s) feasibility study with relevant internal stakeholders and submit a final report to the strategic council.      Initiation finalization of the project proposal must start sequentially after receiving approval from SCB (Strategic Council Board).      Take ownership of Project(s)/product(s) with clear objectives. Questions regarding the feasibility of the execution of a project must be discussed with the management for the final decision.      If you are working on an internal project for NASH, make sure you have enough clarity on the project to execute. In the absence of clarity, please make a note in every meeting to get the required clarity.        Activities Resource Estimation Planning:    Make sure we have the required technical skill availability, the cost target, time target, and resource requirement, before starting execution for internal and/or client project(s).        Define Project SOW    (Statement of work) as per customer requirement, after receiving the confirmation from Customer/Marketing BD. Ensure you have the necessary clarity regarding the conversations with customers and internal meetings recorded and summarized for clear communication with your reporting project team.      Project Manager must plan the execution of sub-modules internally or get it outsourced from the very beginning of the projects or at least after the feasibility test/report.        Identify and create the Project team with the help of all the Functional Managers:    each PM must have a team to execute the project by themselves. No projects must be considered without having enough technical skills and human resources At least 60% of the requirements must be done easily by your team members.      Project Managers will plan the common resource requirements as well (test equipment, test labs, people, others) well in advance. Last-minute requests will be considered based on the availability of resources. Delays in the project will be directly accountable to Project Managers.      Before a project kick-off, it is the project managers responsibility to resolve all relevant and pending queries and uncertainties. Once a project has been initiated, it is the responsibility of the Project Manager to complete the project on time and at the cost target.      Develop a detailed final project plan with milestones that must be vetted by the relevant stakeholders. Ensure the project plan is in line with customer requirements.      Plan the project Kick-off meeting with all Stakeholders once the team is identified.      Submission of the final project proposal with marketing/BD OR the customer.      Project Managers must not accept any changes in the spec, without having clarity on the impact of the changes. If there is a change in spec, it will call for an adjustment in cost and time of the project timeline, it must not be accepted without prior approval by the client and management of Nash Tech Labs.      Managing reports necessary documents as per quality standards QMS requirements: Project Managers are responsible for keeping track of all necessary documents of all the running project(s), each project will have a dedicated folder, which will have the necessary document list.      Ensure System integration is in place for the complete product to make ensure the smooth release of a product you are responsible to remind and follow up with all respective Functional Managers for this critical point till the achievement of a Form-Fit-Function of the final product).      Analyzing Managing project risk (Mitigation plan should be in place): Project Managers must work with Functional Managers/ Lead Engineers of a respective department for the continuous review of the projects technically, if any risks are identified, please address them during your reviews and find and create the mitigation plan.      If the risks cannot be solved or managed, conduct a meeting with the client immediately (Nash Tech Labs management if internal it is a project).      Project Executiocanceled delayed/cancelled if the members are not able to mitigate the risks and come to conclusion on the output or deliverables until a solution is available, and agreeable to all stakeholders.      Managers must report their project in terms of all 10 factors every week: Integration, Scope, Time, Cost, Stakeholders, Procurement, Risk, Communication, Resources, and Quality.      Make and maintain a chart that can explain it all in one small sheet.      Review material tracker as per the BOM and provide feedback to the supply chain management department for timeline improvement wherever required to an inline project plan. Drive to add alternate vendors to add in BOM, wherever there is a single vendor dependency.      Have a track of cost estimation development of the budget, and cost control (Budget Vs Actual). If any additional cost, PM should provide proper justification.      Project Managers are also responsible for the organization motivation of project team(s), monitoring the progress, and providing continuous feedback to stakeholders, as per customer communication.      Project Managers are responsible to highlight the technical training every quarter projects every quarter to the Functional Managers and HR department (only project-specific).      All documents shall be maintained, recorded, and stored for audit at any point in time any phase of the project.      Project Managers are solely responsible for delivering the product(s)/project(s) to the end customer and maintaining cost, time, and intermediate deliverables.      A project manager is required to maintain a database to capture all the courses of action undertaken during a projects life cycle.      Product transfer must be signed-off to the manufacturing facility or customers in case of design services.      Ensure customer satisfaction final approval of product specs during the final stages of the closure of a project.       SOFT SKILLS       Leadership      Communication      Interpersonal Skills      MS-Office      People Management      Time Management      Team Dynamics and Synergy      Delegation of Work      Motivator

column2: We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized individual to join our team as a Storekeeper. The Storekeeper will be responsible for managing inventory, ensuring proper storage and organization of goods, and facilitating efficient operations within our store/warehouse.Roles and Responsibilities :-1. Inventory Management: Keeping track of inventory levels, ordering new supplies, and maintaining stock records.2. Storage Management: Ensuring proper storage of materials to prevent damage or loss.3. Receiving and Dispatching: Receiving incoming shipments, verifying contents, and dispatching materials as needed.4. Documentation: Maintaining accurate records of inventory transactions, receipts, and shipments.5. Quality Control: Inspecting incoming materials for quality and ensuring that outgoing materials meet quality standards.6. Safety Compliance: Adhering to safety protocols and regulations in the storage and handling of materials.7. Communication: Collaborating with other departments, suppliers, and vendors regarding inventory needs and issues.8. ERP and SAP Proficiency: Utilizing ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and SAP (Systems, Applications, and Products) software for inventory management, data analysis, and reporting.Key qualities for a storekeeper with ERP and SAP proficiency include:1. Technical Skills: Proficiency in using ERP and SAP software for inventory management, data analysis, and reporting.2. Organizational Skills: Ability to organize and manage inventory efficiently, ensuring accurate records and timely replenishment.3. Attention to Detail*: Thoroughness in inspecting materials, maintaining records, and ensuring quality standards.4. Problem-Solving Skills: Capability to identify and resolve inventory-related issues effectively.5. Communication Skills: Clear communication with team members, suppliers, and vendors regarding inventory needs and updates.6. Adaptability*: Willingness to adapt to new technologies, processes, and changes in inventory management systems.7. Time Management: Efficiently managing tasks to meet deadlines and maintain smooth operations.8. Team Player: Collaborating with colleagues and contributing to a positive work environment.9. Analytical Skills: Using data analysis tools within ERP and SAP systems to make informed inventory decisions.10.Knowledge of Inventory Principles: Understanding of inventory control principles, including FIFO (First In, First Out) and LIFO (Last In, First Out) methods.
column13: GRN, ERP Implementation, Inventory Control, Material Management, Stock Management

Ensures all purchasing and supplier information in its database are reviewed and updated regularly.    Ensure Engineering Change Orders, Drawing Revisions are processed and implemented by IPO for WAMS in a timely and efficient manner.    Help to develop and maintain global purchasing procedures which are consistent with IPO/WAMS practices and objectives.    Support alignment of global purchasing objectives/procedures/processes between IPO India and Singapore        In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:      Manages the acquisition of all materials for WAMS and provides leadership to ensure Supply Chain Speed improvements are realized through lead time reductions and quality and delivery improvements.      Ensure appropriate plans in place to support short to long term materials availability to WAMS and support meeting deliveries to customers at all times based on Request Dates.    Ensure IPO maintains accurate WW material inventory levels consistent with WAMS needs and inventory goals.    Ensure supplier delivery performances are consistent with WAMS goals and expectations.    Provide leadership for relevant negotiations with suppliers to ensure outstanding quality, cost, lead-times and delivery.    Ensure all contracts and agreements established with suppliers are consistent with WAMS objectives.    Ensure global purchasing processes/procedures are in compliance with WAMS trade import/export/ ICQ and ISO quality requirements.    Ensure record keeping is in compliance to global/WAMS requirements.    Take appropriate actions to resolve outstanding commercial materials issues. Ensure pricing and cost roll ups are properly maintained and price discrepancies are resolved in an appropriate and timely manner. Develop improvement projects to reduce & eliminate waste and inefficiencies in global purchasing processes. Fluent in English (both written and verbal) and effectively connect with Local, Global & cross-functional teams. column2: Actively follow market happenings and keep a track of all optimal & cost-effective routes for the origin and destinations Y-Not operate on.    Weekly: Maintain and report the sailing & air schedules & live costs for all the common origin and destination combinations    Weekly: Maintain and report the live lead times for all the common port of origin and destination combinations. Constantly work towards getting better on lead times and cost.    Maintain and communicate to cross functional teams the lead times involved in shipment preparation, documentation, booking, pick up, transit time, clearance, and door delivery.      Pro-actively get involved at quotation stage of the project itself to finalize the shipping from origin to destination. This would include but not limited to shipping route, special requirement, product packing, labelling, and documentation.      Communicate the packing, labelling and palletizing requirement in detail part of the PO, the details should be with clear drawings with no room for ambiguity.      Be well versed at HS codes, Schedule B and classify the product accurately. Effectively use the General Rules of Interpretation (GRI), General Notes and Trade Preference Provisions to correctly classify for advantageous duty rates while avoiding fines and other regulatory compliance problems. US Specific: Be well versed to use CBP on any doubtful areas.      Work along with sourcing team to understand the customer expectations and propose alternate shipping options with pros and cons & take the required shipping decisions.      Provide a reliable & accurate shipping costs during landed cost calculation by the sourcing team and at any stage of the project.      Maintain control and ensure regulations to all import and export processes and monitor work according to corporate and local policies and evaluate all new custom requirements and supervise everyday operations according to standard procedures.      Take ownership for all the documentation requirement both from manufacturer, customer, and Y-Not standpoint. Clearly communicate documentation requirement (right the first time) without any ambiguity. Maintain documentation requirement checklist for the standard categories and common origin and destination combinations for both sea and air.      Be a reliable and efficient interface with freight forwarders closely follow-up and ensure seamless experience for Y-Not internal and external customers.      Follow up on a weekly basis on shipment readiness on time to connect the shipment on time so that it will reach on time to customers. As it gets closer to the targeted date of shipment readiness, follow up on daily basis.      Take charge & ownership on seaworthy packaging & right labelling by following it up with sourcing team and manufacturer. Validate shipment readiness through video calls and pictures at Manufacturer end and no assumptions.      Take ownership on Track and Trace; Weekly: Keep a tab of current ETA of all the open shipments and keep them updated in internal records and communicate the same.      Proactively follow up at each stage during the finished goods readiness till it reaches customer and resolve all shipment issues right from shipment preparation till delivery to customer.      Perform all record keeping processes and maintain records of EXIM. Maintain Proof of delivery for all shipments with 10 years retention period.      Prepare & maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) & work instructions (WI) to facilitate smooth functioning of shipping operations, ensuring conformance to Service Level Agreements.      Managing cost reduction activities by negotiating with Shipping Liners, CHA, Port Authorities and Transporters for reducing freight, detention & transportation rates      Management reporting (MIS) on transaction cost/ logistics cost etc. with a view to appraise top management also to stakeholders of the routine.     ?

column2: The Layout and Piping Engineer is accountable for design to delivery of piping systems for company s proprietary modular systems in accordance with company standards, client technical requirements and applicable codes.          The above includes preparation of modules plot plan, modules equipment layout, GADs, modules piping layout, piping isometrics, 3D modelling, interaction with various group during modelling, piping stress analysis, piping support selection and layout, equipment nozzle orientation, vent and drain piping layout, process and utility piping design drawing, line list & critical line list, support list, piping MTOBOMs, specialty item list, piping items specifications etc. and assist and guide during procurement, fabrication and installation of piping.              The candidate will provide overall technical leadership for layout and piping                 Ensure:        delivery of piping deliverables to projects by coordinating with other engineering disciplines      preparation of conceptual (in 2D) / final (in 3D) layout of equipment and major piping and E&I items within the modules keeping module size to minimum/optimum considering transport limitations and providing required space for operation, maintenance and egress      preparation of plot plan for modules indicating tie-ins, foundation loads etc.      mechanical design of piping in accordance with process inputs, design basis, contractual technical conditions and codes and standards      preparation of piping layout in 3D. Conducting clash check and updating appropriately      proper layout, selection and design of pipe supports. Preparation of drawings for supports, if required      correctness of MTO quantities      close interface with other disciplines like static equipment, rotating equipment, instrumentation & electrical, civil & structural during detailed engineering and preparation and review of 3D model      Stress analysis of critical lines and subsequent modifications (in line routing, support type and location etc.) to ensure loads transferred to equipment and module structure are within pre-specified limits      preparation of specifications (complete with design specific QA/QC requirements etc.) for piping items, supports and specialty items which can be used for procurement and construction      firmed up nozzle orientations for equipment are shared with concerned disciplines      loads (esp. stress loads) from piping are shared with rotating equipment and civil and structural disciplines for incorporating in design of rotating machinery and structure for modules / skids respectively      support to Supply Chain during procurement of piping items viz. preparation of technical specifications and requisitions for obtaining offers, vendor offer evaluation and providing recommendations, preparation of requisition for purchase, review of vendor documents      assistance during fabrication and inspection stages to ensure critical technology specific aspects in piping are being met      Inspection and testing of piping skids/ modules during fabrication/ construction for conformance with design requirements, project equipment requirements and applicable codes      technical follow-up with vendors/fabricators through proper communications      guidance to module fabricator during construction of modules for issues relating to erection of piping      to meet quality and HSE objectives of the project(s)      support to Sales in preparing cost estimates for piping      support during project close-out activities like Final Data Books etc.        Others        Responsible for technical assurance of piping layout and deliverables      for assigned activities to be executed in accordance with established work processes and contractual requirements and on time and within budget      prepare /maintain/ update execution plan, schedule (in MS Projects) and quality plan for assigned activities      Implement companys HSE procedures      effective prioritization of work when assigned to several projects      interface with project support functions such as planning, procurement etc.      preparation of technical reports related to project and discipline        ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES   :       Assist in planning and tracking of department budget      Identify and track issues and risks for smooth (productive, safe and information security incident free) functioning of department      Preparing and updating department processes and SOPs      Capturing & Management of Department Knowledge lessons learnt, best practices etc.      Keeping department databases updated and generate MIS reports as required      Support Department Compliance & Audits      Assist Supply Chain in vendor qualification and assessment      Assist in project close out      Present a positive attitude with Team members thro productive and open communication       Assistance in Cost Accounting for costing of all department activities        ACADEMIC QUALIFICATION:        Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering        WORK EXPERIENCE:        Min. 8 years in handling layout and unit piping for process industry (refining / petrochemical / specialty and fine chemical/pharma/ bio fuels)      Experience in equipment layout and piping arrangement in modular units / skid projects is preferred        CERTIFICATIONS / LICENSES / TRAININGS:        Training and certification in piping layout, 3D modelling is an added advantage        KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES        Shall be well versed with Piping Material      Analytical ability and hands on experience of design and analyzing piping systems.      Self- motivated, creative, innovative and open minded.      Ability to perform under pressure      Good knowledge of supplier base Effective communication and co-ordination Skills      Proficiency in MS Office (Word, PPT, Excel & Visio, MS Projects)      Basic working experience of ERP viz. SAP, Quickbase      Good working knowledge of Letters or Credit, bank guarantees      Excellent knowledge of ASME, API, ASTM codes as applicable for piping in process industry      Excellent knowledge of piping stress analysis as per ASME B31.1, & other codes      Expertise in 3D software for plant layout and piping like AutoCAD 3D, PDMS, PDS etc.      Construction experience will be an added advantage

column2: Your JobTo support the New Product Development (NPD) Management team by working with customers, sales, engineering, quality, demand/production planning, and manufacturing under the guidance of the New Product Development Manager to ensure project commitments are met, communicate customer requirements internally, and support the cross-functional team.Our TeamMolex is part of the Koch group and for 80 years has been driving innovation in electronics, supporting industries from Automotive to Healthcare and Consumer to Data Communications. That's why our customers rely on Molex to help them master change and create the most important breakthroughs through powerful innovation, engineering excellence, end-to-end supply chain optimization, and world-class manufacturing capabilities.This opportunity is specifically within the Data Communications group addressing Hyperscaler (e.g., Microsoft, Meta, Google, AWS, Nvidia, etc.) Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) architecture buildout. Molexs NPD team develops industry leading SMT, external cable, and BiPass/Flyover solutions that utilize the industrys fastest data transmission speeds (224G PAM4)What You Will Do* Prepare and present new product development opportunities for Managements approval. Manage new product development projects/products from cradle to grave.* Secure capital and stat funding with detailed understanding of the projects numeric metrics such as revenue, COGS, and ROI. This level of responsibility directly impacts the performance (P&L) of the Division.* Provide leadership to Engineering, Signal Integrity, Project Management, Manufacturing, and Quality teams regarding customer/product requirements, timing, and quality expectations.* Active correspondence with sales to understand developing opportunities and track existing customer builds to ensure an optimal Molex support plan. * Work directly with Molex plants around the globe regarding build & allocation plans on New Product Introduction (NPI) lines. Ensure plans align with NPD teams priority.* Track and deliver product samples from inception to first-off-tool though initial production ramp.* Promote new products by maintaining latest customer collateral packages.* Coordinate demo activities for tradeshows like DesignCon, OCP, OFC, etc. * Provide additional support to the product management team in execution of their business plans and day-to-day management of the product family/lines* Demonstrate creative thinking, problem solving skills, and excellent organization.Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)* Bachelor degree in Engineering Mechanical or Electrical preferred.* 2+ years of experience within the high speed datacom market or 4+ years within electro/mechanical components industry.* Sales or Customer Service.* Advanced English.What Will Put You AheadManufacturing experience (e.g., tool/die design/development, automation, quality inspection, etc.)* Minor in Business or Business Administration* Experience working with contract manufacturers and electronics market OEMs.* SAP

column2: We are looking for a Supply Chain Specialist to work with our Global Supply Chain organization    This role has responsibility for implementing the development and implementation of global regional supply chain plans, initiatives and activities that drive flawless Cost Optimization programs for a Strategic Business Unit (SBU)   This position also has responsibility for working across a highly matrixed organization of Product Managers, Supplier Development, and PIC managers (Production and Inventory Controls) to meet the COST, QUALITY, DELIVERY, SPEED and CASH targets for the manufacturing plants and fulfillment centers and delivering the Net Savings Targets for the business for the selected categories         In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Work collaboratively across Supply Chain team as well as with internal and external suppliers, departments and strategic business units to create end-to-end supply chain plans.     Develop and implement robust, accurate and on-time supply chain plans by implementing the product supply chain processes across the Understand - Design - Plan and Implement methodology     Plan for growth and capacity requirements, leverage on supplier capabilities for on-time-to-market, cost and launch readiness     Create cohesive supply chain programs and plans with identifiable critical path, task dependencies, and major breakthroughs, and manages the approved plans and schedules.     Complete Initial RFQ Analysis and prepare a TCO (Total Cost Of Ownership) Model and review with Partners to evaluate cost down opportunity.     Track supply chain metrics to measure cost, service, quality and efficiency tied to Project budgets.       Who You Are:       You promote high visibility of shared contributions to goals. You quickly and significantly take action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. You actively seek input from pertinent sources to make timely and well-informed decisions. You handle the risk that comes with moving forward when the outcome is not certain.      For This Role, You Will Need:       Bachelor s degree or equivalent or above in Supply Chain Management or Mechanical Engineering.      Fluent in English, both Oral and Writing.     Strong negotiation and project management skills within multi-disciplinary teams.      At least 5 years related functional working experience in Supply, Engineering, or Operations. Big Sourcing Program and/or Project leadership experience of cross-functional teams, proof of record of successful projects will be desirable. Experience in Manufacturing industry environment preferred.     Capability in planning and analytics, structured problem solving, facilitating and presentation skills.     Persuasive communication, influencing negotiation skills (internally and externally).     Extensive contract negotiation management, strong supplier management experience. Knowledge of end-to-end supply chain management, global / best cost country (BCC) sourcing and logistics optimization initiatives.       Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Experience in e-Sourcing preferred.     Experience and knowledge of manufacturing and lean preferred.     Experience with core software applications (ERP), preferably with SAP or Oracle.     Microsoft Office skills, Excellent at using Excel on data analysis.
column13: Supply chain management, ERP, Data analysis, SAP, Equity, E-sourcing, Supplier development, RFQ, Oracle, Logistics

column2: The Supplier Development Assistant Manager (SDE) supports the business by improving the Supply Chain performance from a Cost, Speed, Delivery, and Cash perspective.    He/ She shall act as a Foundry / Machining expert and work directly with suppliers for the development of Castings and structured problem-solving to implement improvement programs in all World Area regions.    He shall be responsible for driving Time-bound developments of new Castings and leading the Technical Feasibility review process with Foundries.    She/he has the responsibility of assessing and developing the Foundries through regular Process Assessments to enable them to deliver the level of performance required by our Customers.    She/he will also work closely with Product Supply Chain Leaders, Buyers, Material Managers, and Quality Managers to drive Chronic issues resolution through the root cause and countermeasure (RCCM) process.      Key Responsibilities :     Set and reinforce standards for a safe work environment.    Drive Supplier Transfer programs with Stakeholder engagement, and program management.    Review Supplier Proposals (casting and machined casting) and manufacturing feasibility feedback, discuss with Engineering, and resolve the open issues.    Actively participate in the monthly Buyer Report Out meeting to support Planning and inventory Control managers, Buyer/Planners, and Quality managers through the fast resolution of escalated / repetitive supplier delivery and quality issues, including root causes countermeasures (RCCM), and long-term effective corrective actions.    Monitor key performance indicators, RDSL, and DPPM- Initiate development program on TOP RDSL suppliers. Support chronic DPPM issues to Plant QA. Support Global Supplier Quality in case of chronic issues escalation.    Analyze site forecasts provided to critical suppliers and keep close communication with Operations as well as the supplier to identify programs necessary to maintain supplier performance (stocking program opportunities, adjusting suppliers capacities, etc.)    Ensure Suppliers are trained in Structured Problem Solving, Lean & Six Sigma, and that Supplier management is committed to the use of these tools.

column2: This role will be responsible for managing the Investment steel castings & machining commodities for MSOL sites globally. The job scope includes setting commodity strategies; collaborate with global Supplier base on Quality, Speed, Cost and Risks mitigation to support factories book-build-ship/ customers demand requirements. This includes regional supplier sourcing, development, contracting, DPO & cost negotiations. The role requires the alignment with key Design, Operations stakeholders, and the Global Commodity team in terms of purchasing & risk mitigation strategies, policies, and tactics to achieve objective. Key objectives are to add-value to the company through managing risks, cost, speed & performance aspects of our global suppliers.      In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Identify and develop new, key global casting and machining suppliers in India.     Provides regionalization & risk mitigation sourcing input to ensure surety of material supplies.     Active pursue on Cost Savings via Negotiation, Consolidation & Leverage and E-sourcing tools with Key Global Supply Chain Strategic goals in mind.     Driving Global Supply Chain matrices including quality, speed, cost.     Achieves supplier quality, delivery, lead time and cost performance goals on key commodities for new and existing product programs.     Supports in resolving suppliers supply chain related problems and improve supplier manufacturing and business processes.     Identifies, researches and implements new materials and manufacturing technologies to improve the companys competitive position.     Lead Supplier development and align with key internal/ Global stakeholders.     Participates, as assigned, and supports division/ corporate programs including NMI, DPO, Best Cost Country sourcing, Direct Buy initiatives, Reverse Auctions, Corporate negotiations, Inflation Model, Parts Analysis & Contract management etc.     Supports world area sites by providing, as required, pricing data, lead-times, samples, catalogues, new designs and market trends.     Confers with Quality Assurance, Development Engineering and Marketing to clarify specifications and assure an accurate understanding of project requirements.     Establishes and maintains rapport with critical suppliers to assure a high level of focus on total quality and cost effectiveness.     Collaborates with key stakeholders to understand business priorities and drive key improvement matrices.     Partakes in key projects/ initiatives to drive opportunities for improvement across the Supply Chain.     Plans and conducts regular business reviews with Key Suppliers to ensure aligned goals & business directions.     Provides management with regular recommendations/ updates on commodity matrices performance & related commodity strategies moving forward.     Assists tactical buyers with problem resolution and provide procedural guidance.         Who You Are:         You take action quickly and critically in constantly fast-paced and unexpected situations. You consistently achieve results and completes responsibilities even under tough circumstances. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities.        For This Role, You Will Need:       Degree in Engineering with 3-5 years of experience with strong Sourcing track records in the field of investment steel castings & machining. Commodity & Supplier Performance management, in a manufacturing environment, will be an advantage.     Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.     Comfortable in a dynamic, fast paced, challenging environment.     Comfortable functioning in a highly matrixed organization.     Excellent project management skills from strategic sourcing to operational execution.     Excellent communication skills including presentations and negotiation.     Working knowledge in Lean techniques; SPC, 6-Sigma and Process Improvement tools.

This team at XS CAD delivers core Building Services Design Solutions to MEP Clients across the world including one of the largest.XS CAD has had the privilege of delivering MEP Services to hundreds of projects over the past 15 years including Hospitals, Airports, Stadia, Educational Institutes, Commercial as well as Residential Building Structures.This position would require the candidate to work directly with leading MEP design consulting firms from Australia/USA/UK region who are involved in some of the flag ship projects of their region.   Company DetailsCompany Name  XS CAD INDIA PVT LTD  An UK Based firm.Location  Andheri East, Mumbai  This is complete WFH opportunity. Initial 2 months only from office.Website  www.xscad.comWorking Days  Monday to Friday.This job specifically involves the following key roles and responsibilities-Responsibility for the overall design of HVAC systems & deliverables, including Concept Design, Schematic Design, Design Development, Tender Design / Documentation (including Technical Specifications, BOQ, Schedules and Drawings) under the supervision of Sr. Mechanical Engineer.Perform calculations and prepare mark-ups as required.Use AutoCAD & REVIT to help draftsperson with electrical modelling.Ready to learn new MEP design concepts.Ability to get trained on and work on newer HVAC Design Software.Communicate with clients in written and spoken English.Open to work odd hours if required to meet deadlines.Willingness to accept and implement constructive feedback.Regular communication with the client and taking on design responsibilities on project types like commercial, residential, retail, laboratories & hospitals .Understanding codes & standards local to project location and utilizing the latest & industry leading software.To take on a leadership role with the potential of growing a team reporting to them EXPERIENCE 6+ years of experience in designing of HVAC systems.Experience in design of HVAC systems for commercial, residential, retail projects.Ideally should have experience of sustainability-based projects.Good understating & knowledge of international codes like ASHRAE, SMACNA.Good IT skills comprising Microsoft Office, HVAC cooling load software (Trane Trace, Camel, IES VE etc.), AutoCAD, Bluebeam.Good communication skills and ability to interact with client on a regular basis.Consistently produce accurate work without errors.Experience working on US/UK/Australia projects will be an added advantage.QUALIFICATIONS BE/B. Tech Degree in Mechanical Engineering with relevant technical qualifications.Interested candidates may please share their CV on achavan@xscad.com

column1: Assistant Manager - Product Supply Chain Leader
column2: The   Product Supply Chain Leader   has responsibility for implementing the development and implementation of global & regional supply chain plans, initiatives and activities that drive flawless NPD and Cost Optimization programs for a Strategic Business Unit (SBU). This position also has responsibility for working across a highly matrixed organization of Product Managers, Supplier Development, MMP (Machining/ Metal & Molded Parts) Development Organizations and P&IC managers (Production and Inventory Controls) to meet the COST, QUALITY, DELIVERY, SPEED and CASH targets for the manufacturing plants and fulfillment centers and delivering the Net Savings Targets for the business for the selected categories.    In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:     General    Work collaboratively across Supply Chain team as well as with internal and external suppliers, departments and strategic business units to build end-to-end supply chain plan that reflect all team members inputs and support products launch or cost reduction efforts.   Develop and implement robust, accurate and timely supply chain plans by implementing the product supply chain processes across the Understand - Design - Plan and Implement methodology.   Build cohesive supply chain programs and plans with identifiable critical path, task dependencies, and major breakthroughs, and leads the approved plans and schedules.   Track supply chain metrics to measure cost, service, quality and efficiency tied to Project budgets.    Understand / Design:    Understand the cost drivers for the categories of materials & services.   Leverage Competition among suppliers.   Evaluate and Complete and Make V/S Buy opportunities.   Align with Product Supply Chain Functional Leader to develop partners of choice relationships with the preferred strategic suppliers in line with the Product Supply Chain and Supplier Development Strategy for Machining and Metals & Plastics Category.    Plan for growth and capacity requirements, leverage on supplier capabilities for on-time-to-market, cost and launch readiness.   Align Suppliers to the Strategy by completing due diligence on any new suppliers and finalize the panel of suppliers to invite to drive cost reduction programs.   Host Initial Gate Review - Gate -I.    Plan / Implement:    Collaborate with Operations department to perform make or buy analyses. Challenge if the new material, process or service fit within the current internal network, or should be outsourced.   Complete BOM Cost Reduction Analysis / Should Cost Analysis and create RFP / RFQ documents.   Complete Initial RFQ Analysis and prepare a TCO (Total Cost Of Ownership) Model and review with Partners to evaluate cost down opportunity.   Complete Cost Tensioning using E-Sourcing and conduct Gate - 2 review prior to make an award decision together with - SBU, Supply and Operations Teams involvement.    Set up dual or multi-source if new product demand exceeds supply and handle RCCP.   Complete Formal Award and follow-up with a MSA / MBUSA signoff with the selected supplier to cover handle ongoing relationship and minimize risks to the business.   Actively Participate in the monthly Buyer Report out meeting to support P&IC managers, buyer/planners and quality managers through fast resolution of intensified / repetitive supplier delivery and quality issues, including roots causes countermeasures (RCCM), and long term effective corrective actions.   Partner with Supplier Development Teams to optimize the supply network and resolve supplier performance issues by systematically applying the SPE Framework and Toolkits. column2: If you are an engineering professional, Emerson has an exciting role for you! You will be supporting the application engineering team for large projects in Europe from Fisher Chennai Engineering Center   We value autonomy, self-reliance, fast movers, a passion for robust and maintainable tests, and the ability to ship a quality product         In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:     Review project specifications and prepare preliminary guidelines deviation/clarification sheet.   Perform sizing and selection with Fisher sizing program using customer data and choose the right valve for the application.   Coordinate with Industry support team as when required for special applications/prices and attend quote strategy meetings.   Prepare technical and commercial quotations based on the MIB process with the help of a senior engineer.    Participate in scheduled calls with Sales office/LBP s and resolve project queries.    Support project revisions from Customers.    Support team members to ensure on-time project submission.    To prepare order file upon project award and engage in post-order activities till shipment.          Who You Are:     You have a flare for process improvement and thrive highest quality standard. You quickly and significantly take action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. You actively seek input from pertinent sources to make timely and well-informed decisions. Works collaboratively with project managers and Factory personnel to resolve conflicts if it may arise.       For This Role, You Will Need:     In-depth knowledge of control valve products and industry application    Knowledge of Fisher products and accessories would be a plus.   Minimum 3 years experience in control valves engineering    Good understanding of product specifications and Incoterms    Develop and present innovative solutions for problems if they may arise.    Optimizes work processes and improves performance metrics.    Awareness of other Emerson products Good knowledge of Inactive/obsolete/Competitor products      Should be an effective team player for on-time project submission.     Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Degree in Mechanical / Instrumentation / Chemical / Metallurgical Engineering.   Strong interpersonal skills   Excellent written and verbal communication skills   Ready to take up any new challenges.    Time management, Problem Solving, and decision-making Skills.

column2: Should have Experience of 5-10 years in the area of Production, PPC, Industrial Engg. Or similar function    Adequate knowledge of Plant, Machinery & processes, he is exposed to in the current company    Should be conversant with the production / shop floor systems, relevant ERP or similar systems    Should be able communicate & get the work done from Supervisors & workmen      KEY RESPONSIBILITIES     Plan, improve and design PPC system, to carry out production to meet the promised delivery dates consistent with minimum cost and product quality standard    Work closely with Sales team to understand the priorities and incorporate them through proper Production, Planning and Control department activities to achieve customer commitments and project timelines    Co-ordinate the production activities of different internal departments & ensuring smooth flow of materials by eliminating bottlenecks if any.    Plan, co-ordinate and ensure production and smooth flow of bought out components from vendor s facility in line with internal demand & customer commitments    Maintain adequate but not excessive stock of raw materials, WIP, and of finished goods to meet production requirements and delivery schedules at the most economical level in co-ordination with Purchase department    Manage all production resources efficiently to deliver production volumes on time, highest yield and productivity    To co-ordinate & utilize labor, materials, and equipment most effectively and economically    Resolve workflow bottle necks to achieve maximum production efficiency, lower production costs and improve product quality    Establish production and delivery targets, checking it against performance and submit MIS reports time to time    Build, design and maintain flexibility in manufacturing operations, to accommodate rush jobs or to meet contingencies.    Work and plan alternative production strategies in case of emergencies.    Ensure capacity utilization is in tune with forecast demand at all the time    Understand vendor managed products and manufacturing processes and plan them in such a way that there is no impact on our production and dispatch commitments    Co-ordinate & Work cross-functionally with other plant teams like Sales, Projects (On-site Installation teams), Dispatch, Supply chain, Quality, Engineering, and other stakeholders to improve production process, quality, cost control and productivity.    Maintain and document PPC records, process changes and process control wherever appropriate    Communicate & motivate entire production team by creating a learning, problem solving, improvement oriented environment / culture      REQUIRED SKILLS     Should have exposure to shop floor improvement projects to increase Productivity, Output, Safety, Ease of handling etc.    Should be conversant with Plant SOPs, Documentation, Visual SOPs & modern practices across industries    Conversant with MRP Software and effective utilization of the same    Possibly aware of MOST or similar other work measurement systems    Should have basic knowledge to implement JIT (Just in Time) concept    Exposure to the WCM / TPM / Six Sigma / Equivalent System for Plant improvement    Should be conversant with ISO / OHSAS & similar systems    Should have good knowledge of Computers using Excel, Word, PowerPoint & any ERP related to his company    Good Communication skills - written and oral, Personal Attributes:    Ability to handle pressure & deliver in demanding situation    Diploma / Degree in Engineering from reputed University    Should have Experience of 5+ years in the area of PPC, Production, Quality Assurance, Industrial Engg.    Should be working in PPC or Production area / activities in his current role    Local or should be ready to relocate near Factory / Umbergaon / Vapi Salary would be in line with the experience

column2: This role is part of Arcadis Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis offices globally   The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world   For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as well as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety   Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses   The GEC model is well embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique    Our Business Transformation (Management Consulting) team is recognised in the market for the quality of its people; our busy Procurement Supply Chain team is a key part of this team, providing deep expertise across this core consulting discipline   You will need a strong intellect, the ability to articulate complex ideas persuasively and a talent for showing clients that we have the right solutions to their most pressing issues, as well as excellent, proven procurement supply chain skills    Supply chain relationships are key to the success of our clients   At Arcadis, we get excited about bringing clients and suppliers closer together and finding new sources of value   Informed by our deep sector experience, our solutions deliver across the procurement lifecycle, from transformational strategic supply chain development to specific offerings ,for example in effective incentivisation and management of risk, and reflect the cultural levers required to drive collaboration, innovation and trust   We are looking for talented Senior and Principal Consultants to help us to further strengthen and grow our work in this area    Our experts in procurement and supply chain management work closely with broader technical, delivery and consulting skills from across Arcadis, providing both best practice market insights and practical implementation advice         Our end-to-end service offer includes:      Supply Chain Strategy: creating strategic change and actionable plans to align supply chains with clients business objectives and priorities. This includes embedding new capabilities and ways of working in our clients organisations, including skills and operating models to meet future business needs.    Procurement Delivery: a fully comprehensive procurement service, which delivers robust and efficiently priced contracts, with pace and assurance, typically within the public and private sectors.    Build Capability: developing comprehensive supplier performance management systems and processes to support the continuous improvement of our clients    Delivering Outcomes: Building resilience sustainability within the supply chain, and rapidly delivering cost customer performance improvements      Role accountabilities:     Leadership and management of client projects through their lifecycle, from initial pitch through to solution design and activity planning, successful delivery, and knowledge capture    Diagnosing and tackling complex procurement and supply chain-related business problems, across large-scale consulting engagements, designing and implementing solutions that can demonstrate benefits and value delivered    Leading and delivering complex procurement services, from initial development of sourcing strategy through the entire contract lifecycle to tender and contract award.    Analysing markets, trends, risks and opportunities, to provide fresh insights to clients    Communicating potential solutions and outcomes to clients and stakeholders    Continuous development of our supply chain services and sector-specific offerings       Whilst potential is more important to us than experience, you will also have at least some of the following key skills and expertise:      Demonstrable track record of delivery of supply chain or procurement projects in a relevant sector (Public Sector, Infrastructure, Energy, Utilities, Oil Gas,Transportation, Healthcare, Defence, Property, Financial Services, etc), in one or more of capital delivery; operations maintenance;   Demonstrable track record of leadership and delivery of major procurement and supply chain services across the procurement and supply chain lifecycle, from strategic sourcing and category management to tender and award;    Demonstrable relevant experience in market engagement (including shaping and development); supplier relationship management; procurement governance and compliance; procurement and supply chain sustainability; organisational design; process improvement    Experience in designing, leading and delivering multiple-stream projects to a high quality from understanding client need to project completion.    Knowledge and understanding of key skills and components that make a successful management consultant   Demonstrate understanding of how management consulting projects are typically delivered - from project start mobilisation, through to delivering clients requirements and expectations    Knowledge and appreciation of identifying new opportunities and supporting proposals to secure work    Knowledge of the application of best practice in aspects of supply chain management, which could include:     Strategic sourcing and category management      Operational procurement delivery      Commercial and Contract management      Supplier performance and relationship management      Risk management and mitigation strategies      Procurement governance compliance - policy process development      Supply/demand planning      Product management      Supply chain reporting, data analytics and digitisation     Demonstrable ability to understand and assess business problems, and build and communicate practical improvement recommendations    A leader, with strong coaching and leadership skills and the ability to create diverse teams, bringing your team with you    Credible and able to perform effectively with senior leaders    Ability to carry out market, trend and/or business/supply chain performance analysis    Project leadership including management of other professional team members, or comparable in an industry role    Desirable MCIPS, or interest in working towards MCIPS
column13: Procurement, Supply chain, Relationship management, Supply chain management, Business transformation, Contract management, Process improvement, Healthcare, Risk management, Financial services

column2: As a Purchase Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the procurement process, ensuring the timely and cost-effective acquisition of materials, equipment, and services required for various projects    Your role will be crucial in maintaining a smooth workflow and supporting the successful execution of our MEP contracts    The ideal candidate should possess strong negotiation skills, excellent attention to detail, and a deep understanding of the MEP industry     Responsibilities:     Develop and implement effective procurement strategies and policies specific to MEP projects, ensuring compliance with company guidelines and industry regulations.    Identify and source potential suppliers, contractors, and subcontractors for various project requirements, while maintaining a comprehensive supplier database.    Conduct market research to stay up-to-date with the latest trends, pricing, and availability of MEP materials, equipment, and services.    Evaluate supplier capabilities, conduct vendor assessments, and negotiate favorable terms and conditions to ensure competitive pricing, quality, and timely delivery of goods and services.    Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to determine project material and equipment requirements, providing input on technical specifications, alternatives, and cost-saving opportunities.    Prepare and issue purchase orders, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and adherence to budgetary constraints.    Monitor and track purchase orders, follow up with suppliers to ensure on-time delivery, resolve any delays or issues, and maintain updated records of procurement activities.    Conduct regular supplier performance evaluations, addressing any performance or quality issues, and initiate corrective actions as necessary.    Coordinate with the finance department to ensure accurate and timely processing of invoices, payments, and budget control.    Stay updated with industry regulations, market conditions, and emerging technologies in the MEP field, recommending innovative procurement strategies to optimize processes and reduce costs.     People Management Skills:     Lead, mentor, and supervise a team of procurement professionals, providing guidance, support, and training to enhance their skills and performance.    Set clear performance expectations, establish goals, and provide regular feedback to team members to drive continuous improvement and ensure the achievement of departmental objectives.    Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment, promoting effective communication and teamwork among team members and other departments.    Resolve conflicts and address employee concerns in a timely and constructive manner, promoting a positive and supportive work culture.    Conduct performance evaluations, identify training needs, and facilitate professional development opportunities to enhance the capabilities and growth of the procurement team.     Requirements:     Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field. Relevant certifications.    Proven work experience as a Purchase Manager or similar role within the MEP contracting industry.    In-depth knowledge of MEP materials, equipment, and services, and a strong understanding of industry standards and specifications.    Demonstrated ability to develop and implement effective procurement strategies, policies, and procedures.    Proficiency in procurement software and systems, and advanced knowledge of MS Office applications.    Strong negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with internal teams, suppliers, and contractors.    Ability to work under pressure, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.    Familiarity with legal and contractual requirements related to procurement processes.    Strong ethical standards and a commitment to promoting sustainable and socially responsible procurement practices

column2: Ensure that the warehouse operates at peak efficiency - with customer satisfaction the primary goal - by supervising, organizing, and training warehouse employees and establishing, monitoring, and managing operational goals.   Distribution management involves moving finished goods from a manufacturer or supplier to the so-called end user. The process includes warehousing, inventory management, packing, shipping, and delivery.   Daily operations involve receiving, organizing, and dispatching goods. This includes tasks such as inventory management, order processing, and ensuring the overall efficiency of the storage and retrieval systems.   Warehouses also serve as distribution centres, allowing businesses to fulfil orders efficiently. With a well-managed warehouse, businesses can pick and pack orders accurately and quickly, reducing lead times and improving customer satisfaction.   Develop warehouse operations systems by determining product handling and storage requirements, equipment utilization, inventory, gate processes, and shipping methods.   Train and manage the warehouse team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals.   Review and prepare workflows, staffing requirements, space allocations, equipment layouts, and action plans that meet company standards for productivity, quality, and customer service.   Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing and enforcing standards and procedures and by complying with legal regulations.         Responsibilities:       Responsible for Sales & Distribution value chain management.   Responsible for creating an Invoices for Outbound deliveries.   Responsible for Finished goods Tracing and Stacking.   Schedule and oversee the dispatch planning.   Good knowledge in HSN codes and Tax process.   Supervise daily warehouse activities, including quality assurance, inventory control, space management, logistics, floor productivity, shipping, and customer service.   Oversee and manage logistics for transporting products to customers and company facilities, communicating with drivers and air partners to ensure efficient delivery of packages.       Your Profile / Qualifications       Required skills and qualifications:       Bachelors degree or equivalent   Minimum 5-10 years of experience in a warehouse distribution role in manufacturing Industry.   Proficiency with warehouse procedures and policies.   Excellent problem-solving skills and leadership qualities.   Ability to work collaboratively with all levels of company staff.   Ability to deliver effective feedback, both written and verbal.   Good communication skills and SAP knowledge.         Additional requirements:       Language known: English, Kannada is mandatory and Hindi in an optional.

column2: A ServiceNow developer is a professional responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining applications on the ServiceNow platform.        DEME General      ICT      India       Your responsibilities         You lead intake meetings with our internal clients, translate user requirements to technical solutions - In line with best practices and internal policy.        You coordinate the delivery of products, clearly assessing the required efforts and providing clear expectations for your internal clients.        Your main driver is the platforms customer s success.        You take full ownership of the ServiceNow platform.        You keep the platform in good health (up to date with the latest releases patches) and regularly review health scans and act when points of improvement are offered.        You are responsible for the overall quality of the delivered solutions   You perform acceptance testing for any updates developed by yourself or the support Team, from both the technical and end-user perspective and follow the internal Change Management Processes. You diligently follow-up on any incidents related to the platform.        You stay up to date on the latest developments in the world of ServiceNow (through networking, seminars, training ...) and explore how platform changes and the release of new features can be leveraged in our environment, so that DEME can make the most of its investment.            You have a bachelors degree        You are ITIL Foundation certified (or able to demonstrate knowledge of the Framework)        You can demonstrate hand-on sys-admin/scripting/development experience with the ServiceNow platform and in particular the ITSM SPM modules        You are able to clearly translate user requirements to a technical solution        You have an eye for detail and thus deliver consistent, qualitative work        You are fluent in English, both written and spoken           An extensive mobility program for a healthy work-life balance      A permanent training track which allows you to develop yourself personally and professionally;      A stimulating, innovative workplace with numerous growth opportunities;      A people-oriented environment with an interactive health program and a focus on employee wellbeing

column2: If you are a Supply Chain professional, Emerson has an exciting role for you! We are looking for a Supply Chain Specialist to work with our Global Supply Chain Organization.      This role has responsibility for supporting risk mitigation initiatives by helping establish dual source supply base and establishing baseline performance metrics.      Focus will be to optimize the current external supplier base by authorizing new additions, driving supplier consolidation initiatives aiming to focus business to the best suppliers only and making recommendation for new sources and innovation.      .  In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:       Support Pressure Management business by improving the Supply Chain performance from a Cost, Speed, Delivery and Cash perspective     Implement Supplier Development Strategy and supervise key performance indicators, Lead Time (LT), Requested Delivery Service Level (RDSL), and Defective Parts per Million (DPPM)     Find opportunities, develop plans and timelines with existing suppliers to improve their ability to meet the required performance     Work directly with suppliers using Perfect Execution concepts and structured problem solving to implement improvement programs         Who You Are:       You have strong customer focus and build collaborative relationships across the organization. You get results and are action oriented. You optimally communicate in various settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, or among diverse styles and position levels. You have a sophisticated style seen as being direct and truthful.        For This Role, You Will Need:       Bachelor s degree or equivalent in Operations, Supply Chain, Engineering or Business     Minimum 5 years of experience in Supplier Development, Continuous Improvement / Lean Management or Sourcing     Root Cause analysis experience     Supplier corrective action requests (SCARS) or supplier scorecards experience     Must be self-sufficient and require little, if any, direct supervision or guidance     Strong communication skills     Capability in planning and analytics and structured problem solving     Microsoft Office skills, especially MS-Excel skills         Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:       Six sigma black belt     Knowledge of purchasing, material flows and manufacturing processes     Experience with ERPs, preferably with Oracle or SAP in planning and / or purchasing.     Strong negotiation (internally and externally) and project management skills.
column13: Supply chain, Service level, SAP, Project management, Equity, Oracle, Continuous improvement, Supplier development, Six sigma black belt, Analytics
